excerpts: I usually get a variation of The Original with skinless dark thigh meat.
the original.author: Katy Y.
the original.review:
I came here for the first time 2 weeks ago and I've been craving it ever since, so I got R&R again for lunch today. I'm on a low carb diet but I ate the entire bowl of rice because it's just too good!

Rooster & Rice is a super simple, warm meal that makes you feel at home. Plus you feel good about yourself afterwards because poached chicken and rice are healthy! They have the most flavorful rice I've ever had and the ginger soy sauce is AMAZING. I usually get a variation of The Original with skinless dark thigh meat. The little cup of chicken broth is a nice touch too. 

Lines get long around lunchtime so come a little earlier/later. It's also slightly more expensive than it should be, but it's worth to me.

excerpts: Ordered the Original - chicken breast and thigh with skin, rice, cucumber, and their special sauce.
I poured myself hot sauce on the side.
The food is fresh and after eating a boatload of it, you still feel good because it's so healthy.
Tastewise......
well, their special sauce really made the flavor.
Lot's of ginger
but overall I was surprised the flavor was good.
Definitely worth a try.
the original.author: Erica C.
the original.review:
I was very hesitant to eat here because the pictures make the food look extremely bland and tasteless. My friend convinced me to try it and meet him for lunch so I decided not to knock it til I try it.

Ordered the Original - chicken breast and thigh with skin, rice, cucumber, and their special sauce. I poured myself hot sauce on the side. The food is fresh and after eating a boatload of it, you still feel good because it's so healthy. Tastewise......well, their special sauce really made the flavor. Lot's of ginger but overall I was surprised the flavor was good. Definitely worth a try.

excerpts: I usually get The Original, but the options only get healthier from there, with The Paleo being the healthiest.
The rice is unbelievable, and I have no idea how they season it
so well
but it's probably my favorite part of the meal.
the original.author: Alice C.
the original.review:
I can't believe I've been here so many times and haven't written a review yet! This is one of my go-to lunch places because it's so delicious and healthy. It's just chicken and rice (+ a few cucumbers and cilantro), but they somehow make it taste amazing.

I usually get The Original, but the options only get healthier from there, with The Paleo being the healthiest. The rice is unbelievable, and I have no idea how they season it so well but it's probably my favorite part of the meal. The chicken always tastes fresh and tender, and the broth that the meal comes with is the perfect addition (especially on a cold day or if you're sick). Definitely add their habanero sauce if you're a fan of spicy food! That and the ginger soy sauce it comes with go really well together.

There's always a line at lunch, so come before 12 or after 1 if you don't want to wait very long. There's some seating inside, but there's plenty of seating at the center of the plaza, which I would recommend if it's a nice day out!

excerpts: I went for "The Original", which comprised skin-on chicken white meat on top of seasoned rice.
The rice is gorgeously seasoned - not sure how they've done it, but it's incredible.
The chicken is flavourful enough to stand on its own, but not so much so that it's out of balance.
There's a delicious soy/ginger sauce that you can use either for dipping, or pour all over your dish (I opted for the latter).
the original.author: Sebastian M.
the original.review:
I came here for lunch with teammates on a wam September afternoon. It's nestled in the corner of a fairly drab office plaza.

I went for "The Original", which comprised skin-on chicken white meat on top of seasoned rice. The rice is gorgeously seasoned - not sure how they've done it, but it's incredible. The chicken is flavourful enough to stand on its own, but not so much so that it's out of balance. There's a delicious soy/ginger sauce that you can use either for dipping, or pour all over your dish (I opted for the latter). And to top it off, they have a house habanero sauce - like Sriracha but better - a drizzle goes a long way, so beware!

There's lots of seating inside and outside, although much of the outside seats are ledges, so if it's busy you'll probably be holding your meal in your lap.

I'd definitely go back, and would strongly recommend it if you're looking for a simple, delicious Thai meal at a reasonable price.

excerpts: THE ORIGINAL (5/5)
I ordered "The Original" which included thigh meat along with breast.
I asked if I could have *only* breast and they accommodated.
I
*almost* ordered the soft boiled egg as an extra but decided I wanted to just have it plain the first time around.
the original.author: Darien R.
the original.review:
I had the chance to try Hainan Chicken or Hainanese Chicken in Singapore a few years back.  It was outstanding.  We all loved it and couldn't get it out of our minds.  I think the Thai also have a similar dish by the name of Khao Mun Gai.  Come to think of it, I think the Chinese also have a poached chicken dish that is somewhat similar.  Seems like every culture has a version of this dish!

Since that trip, we've been trying to find some authentic-tasting Hainan Chicken here in the States and it's been difficult.  You can find it, it's just hard to find it done right.

I love the simplicity of the dish, the bare, skinless chicken and that garlic and ginger infused broken rice.  It's so light and refreshing.

THE ORIGINAL (5/5) I ordered "The Original" which included thigh meat along with breast.  I asked if I could have *only* breast and they accommodated.  I *almost* ordered the soft boiled egg as an extra but decided I wanted to just have it plain the first time around. It comes with cucumber and cilantro garnish and a clear chicken broth.  I was craving spice!

It was so delicious - the meat is so tender and that sauce goes so well with the chicken.  The rice is like crack-cocaine, you just can't stop eating it (not that I've ever tried crack-cocaine)!!  The rice, with that chicken, and that sauce is such a magical combination.  I can completely understand why this restaurant has made the choice to sell only this dish!

Love this place.  Love the concept.  Love their food.

excerpts: The Original - Poached, organic chicken over fragrant chicken rice, garnished with cucumber and cilantro.
the original.author: Matthew C.
the original.review:
Simplicity is key at Rooster & Rice. The incredibly minimal menu specializes in Khao Mun Gai, poached chicken on top of jasmine rice. At first glance, that might not sound all that sexy, but trust me, it's sexy!

A line out the door on a Tuesday afternoon took around 10 minutes to get up to the front. The tiny space was packed with locals mostly ordering take out, but with lots of options to dine outdoors why take it back to the office?

The Original - Poached, organic chicken over fragrant chicken rice, garnished with cucumber and cilantro. Served with a fresh chili, ginger, garlic and soybean sauce and a side of chicken broth. I amped the flavors up to 11 by dousing the chicken in habanero sauce. Score!

Again, poached chicken isn't necessarily the girl next door, if you will. However, each ingredient is prepared carefully and executed well. For $11.95 I really can't complain about the portion size for the price. But I'll admit I could've used an XL portion!

It does get a little crazy inside, especially when folks don't listen for their numbers to be called, then it backs up the operation. For those looking for something extra, order a freshly cracked coconut for your pleasure! 

Rooster & Rice hits the nail on the head for a reliable, affordable and relatively healthy lunch.

excerpts: The Original: Breast and thigh with skin, poached organic Mary's chicken over fragrant jasmine chicken rice, garnished with cucumber and cilantro, Served with a fresh chili, ginger, garlic, soybean sauce, and a side of chicken broth ($11.95).
One of my favorite preparations of chicken is the Chinese style poached chicken, so I was excited to try this.
The chicken was tender and moist.
The sauce super flavorful.
The rice also had a nice savory note as I believe it was cooked in chicken stock.
The soup was clean and refreshing.
I've had this dish at a popular spot in Portland, so I was missing the chilis they gave us with that meal.
the original.author: Elena N.
the original.review:
For our weekly office lunch, I decided to get part one from Rooster & Rice. Our delivery order arrived on Friday, June 8th around 12:15pm via Caviar.

I got The Original: Breast and thigh with skin, poached organic Mary's chicken over fragrant jasmine chicken rice, garnished with cucumber and cilantro, Served with a fresh chili, ginger, garlic, soybean sauce, and a side of chicken broth ($11.95). One of my favorite preparations of chicken is the Chinese style poached chicken, so I was excited to try this. The chicken was tender and moist. The sauce super flavorful. The rice also had a nice savory note as I believe it was cooked in chicken stock. The soup was clean and refreshing. I've had this dish at a popular spot in Portland, so I was missing the chilis they gave us with that meal. Added a nice spice which I wish I had.

Great spot for Thai style chicken and rice. (Though a lot of people in my office thought this was too real. But they only really eat American Asian food.) I do adore a good khao man gai.

excerpts:
Since it was my first time, I thought I go for:

THE ORIGINAL - $11.95
Breast and Thigh with skin, jasmine white rice.
the original.author: Tu-Anh N.
the original.review:
TIME: TUESDAY @11:30am

SEATING: there's some communal seating indoors and some tables outdoors.

I'm so glad I planned for an early lunch (they open at 11am) because by the time it was noon, a line was formed.  I came at 11:30am and there was no line!

Since it was my first time, I thought I go for:

THE ORIGINAL - $11.95
Breast and Thigh with skin, jasmine white rice.
Poached, organic chicken over fragrant chicken rice, garnished with cucumber and cilantro. Served with a fresh chili, ginger, garlic and soybean sauce and a side of chicken broth.

They also have slices you can add:
- Thai Sriracha - sweet and mild. Goes so well with the chicken and rice!
- Habanero - didn't try it but I'm sure it's very spicy.

The chicken was tender and I loved the thigh (dark meat).  I love my food rich so I enjoyed all the skin that came with it!  The chicken rice was soft and everything I want in white rice--and there was a good amount of it!  As for the soybean sauce it comes with, although I don't like ginger, it's not terribly gingery. There's some peanuts in em!  This sauce is good if you want your food saltier, but I prefer the Thai Sriracha!

If you don't stuff yourself, you can turn this into 2 small meals--which is actually the portion we should be eating, hehe.  For the quality and amount you get in San Francisco, the price really isn't bad.  This place keeps it simple with simple food that tastes pretty darn good!

I'd like to come back and try the vegetarian! Oh and the staff is very friendly and attentive, even when it's just one person up front with a long line.

excerpts: You can choose between 4 variations, "The Original" has breast & thigh w/skin, jasmine white rice, "The Marina" has skinless breast, organic brown rice, "The Vegetarian" had organic tofu, brown rice and seasonal veggies and "The Paleo
" has breast/thigh and seasonal veggies.
the original.author: Chelsea W.
the original.review:
Rooster & Rice is really overhyped and I'm surprised there are so many good ratings. The chicken and rice itself are pretty ordinary, and the sauce is really the only good part of the dish.

Given the there's a new location in SoMa, I decided to give it another try, but it was just as plain and ordinary as I remembered. You can choose between 4 variations, "The Original" has breast & thigh w/skin, jasmine white rice, "The Marina" has skinless breast, organic brown rice, "The Vegetarian" had organic tofu, brown rice and seasonal veggies and "The Paleo" has breast/thigh and seasonal veggies. It comes out to about $14 which is pretty overpriced in my opinion. 

I had the "Paleo" and it was so-so. The seasonal veggies are always steamed broccoli, so it really doesn't stand out to me too much. I imagine that its a popular place since its a healthier option in the area.

excerpts: I ordered "The Original," which comes with chicken breast and thigh with skin, jasmine white rice, cucumber, cilantro, and a fresh chili, ginger, garlic and soybean sauce.
To be honest, without the sauce, the meal would have been quite bland -- it's your standard chicken and rice dish.
But the sauce is fragrant, a wonderful complement to drizzle over the chicken and rice.
Everyone should come to Rooster & Rice at least once during their time in San Francisco simply to try the sauce!

It's difficult to describe, and is a flavor I don't think I've ever experienced before - the ginger shines through but doesn't overwhelm, the chili and garlic add the perfect kick, and the soybean rounds it out with a nice savoriness.
the original.author: Claire L.
the original.review:
Rooster & Rice is delicious, but what really differentiates their menu items and food is the sauce! I ordered "The Original," which comes with chicken breast and thigh with skin, jasmine white rice, cucumber, cilantro, and a fresh chili, ginger, garlic and soybean sauce. To be honest, without the sauce, the meal would have been quite bland -- it's your standard chicken and rice dish. But the sauce is fragrant, a wonderful complement to drizzle over the chicken and rice. Everyone should come to Rooster & Rice at least once during their time in San Francisco simply to try the sauce! It's difficult to describe, and is a flavor I don't think I've ever experienced before - the ginger shines through but doesn't overwhelm, the chili and garlic add the perfect kick, and the soybean rounds it out with a nice savoriness. Simple ingredients that on their own may seem uninspiring and ordinary, but together, pack a powerful punch. 

However, I will caution that after the meal, I felt extremely heavy and bloated. I would definitely recommend splitting it into two separate meals because I felt extremely sleepy and sluggish afterwards. While portioning it out was my original plan, the meal was so delicious that I couldn't resist myself and devoured the entire thing!

excerpts: I ordered the original - seasoned jasmine rice with poached chicken and it comes with a side of broth.
I also ordered a poached egg for a few extra, but totally worth it!
It's not a fancy sit down, as every order comes in a take out container but who cares.
The food is excellent.
The chicken is juicy, the rice perfectly seasoned, and broth reminds me of home cooking/cozy feelings that warm your tummy.
the original.author: Jane K.
the original.review: I love it when simple things have been perfected. And that is exactly what rooster and rice is -- perfection. I ordered the original - seasoned jasmine rice with poached chicken and it comes with a side of broth. I also ordered a poached egg for a few extra, but totally worth it! It's not a fancy sit down, as every order comes in a take out container but who cares. The food is excellent. The chicken is juicy, the rice perfectly seasoned, and broth reminds me of home cooking/cozy feelings that warm your tummy.

excerpts: There's the original, marina (no skin), paleo and vegetarian.
Don't forget to take a magnet!
Free and cute for the fridge!
the original.author: Caitlyn S.
the original.review: Y'all this is home! Rooster & Rice is perfect. You get soup and a nice portion of rice and chicken to make you happily full. I recommend combining their habanero and sriracha together and adding it on the rice. The brown sauce they provide is pretty good too! I'm usually not a cilantro and ginger fan, but it's not overpowering and sweet. The soup is so so good. My favorite part about this place is that there's only four options so you don't have to spent years trying to decide what you want. There's the original, marina (no skin), paleo and vegetarian. Don't forget to take a magnet! Free and cute for the fridge!

excerpts: For food, I went with the original that's a mix of thigh and leg meat (skin on) on a bed of rice.
What really makes it special is the gingery garlic sauce that it's sided with - make sure to pour it all on generously as you wont regret it.
The food will satisfy without making you feel like you're carrying a small child in your stomach
the original.author: Ryan C.
the original.review:
A quick and healthy spot for lunch.

Came with a group of co-workers during meal time and there was a pretty big line wrapping around the restaurant. The menu is limited, so that definitely helps make the decision process easy, but what's really great is that they turn around the food super fast so that you're not standing around wasting precious eating time.

For food, I went with the original that's a mix of thigh and leg meat (skin on) on a bed of rice. What really makes it special is the gingery garlic sauce that it's sided with - make sure to pour it all on generously as you wont regret it. The food will satisfy without making you feel like you're carrying a small child in your stomach and you'll probably still have room for dessert without feeling guilty when you're done.

There are a few tables inside, but good luck - they also have some communal seating outside if the weather is nice. Probably better to avoid trying to secure a spot if you're going with a group and just taking your food to-go and eating in a park or other communal space.

excerpts: I always get the original...
it's the way to go!
Pro tip: go around 11:30am to avoid the long lines during lunchtime.
the original.author: Cathy C.
the original.review: I am pretty much obsessed with this place. It's my go to lunch spot because it's filling yet somehow it doesn't make me feel completely terrible afterwards. The sauce is so flavorful, and the seasoned rice is so fragrant and addictive. I always get the original... it's the way to go! Pro tip: go around 11:30am to avoid the long lines during lunchtime.

excerpts: Unfortunately there's not a lot of easily accessible places in SF that make decent Khao Mun Gai, so as a slave to the laws of supply and demand, I find myself crawling back here more often than I'm willing to admit to order another bowl of the Original with a side of an egg.
the original.author: Jenni H.
the original.review:
As a lazy millennial who regularly takes the bus for 10 minute foot commutes, I would actually consider walking the 20 minutes to Rooster & Rice during my lunch break everyday. Do not underestimate the significance of this decision from the perspective of a highly sedentary individual.

Forget the fact I'm being charged an exorbitantly inflated price for what is just chicken and rice. Or that the meal is so incredibly sodium-generous that I hydrate enough afterwards to probably spike our water bill for the month. This place is the bomb. If i could, I would hook myself up to an IV drip of their chicken broth soup.

Unfortunately there's not a lot of easily accessible places in SF that make decent Khao Mun Gai, so as a slave to the laws of supply and demand, I find myself crawling back here more often than I'm willing to admit to order another bowl of the Original with a side of an egg.

excerpts: I got the original which came with chicken, rice, and a bowl of soup.
The chicken was juicy and tender, and went well with the soy sauce they provided.
It in itself didn't taste like anything, but that's where the sauce comes into play
I guess.
the original.author: Elvi T.
the original.review:
Okay price for hainan chicken, but everything was pretty spot on in terms of quality and quantity. 

I got the original which came with chicken, rice, and a bowl of soup. The chicken was juicy and tender, and went well with the soy sauce they provided. It in itself didn't taste like anything, but that's where the sauce comes into play I guess. The chicken broth really hit the spot and completed the meal - it was hot, rich, and flavorful.

excerpts: but they don't need to have more selections because their hainan chicken taste sooo good, especially the original one.
the original.author: Wenjing Y.
the original.review:
Limited variety but they don't need to have more selections because their hainan chicken taste sooo good, especially the original one. I sometimes choose the paleo one when I don't want to eat carb. 

Only complains are: it looks like a very quick to assemble dish, but I normally need to wait 5+ min for it, sometimes even 15 min. Hope they can make it faster

excerpts: Got the original Chicken Rice and it was just what I needed!
Definitely recommend this place for a quick bite,
especially if you're a fan of Hainanese Chicken Rice or its Thai counterpart, Khao Man Gai.
the original.author: Julian L.
the original.review:
Chicken rice is one of my favorite dishes and oh man had I been missing it! Rooster & Rice did not disappoint as they really stuck to the basics on the dish and served it straight up - with optional sauces on the side.

Pros: good food, decent prices (for downtown SF), fast service
Cons: Minimal seating, no sit-down option (only served in to-go boxes)

Notes: Location is in a nice, open plaza (so that kind of makes up for the lack of in-door seating, so long as it's nice out) with dessert and drink options nearby. Parking is basically as you would expect in downtown.

Got the original Chicken Rice and it was just what I needed! Definitely recommend this place for a quick bite, especially if you're a fan of Hainanese Chicken Rice or its Thai counterpart, Khao Man Gai.

excerpts: I went with the original with an egg, which was a decent portion and the egg was pretty well done.
the original.author: Wayne H.
the original.review:
Very solid hainan chicken and rice. It's a not a great amount of food for the price, but about right for San Francisco lunch prices. You get chicken, rice, sauce, and a bowl of soup for the price, and you can also add egg, extra chicken, or extra sauce for a few dollars more. I went with the original with an egg, which was a decent portion and the egg was pretty well done.  The broth was just okay, while the chicken, rice, and sauce were pretty spot on. I could have done with more sauce than what was given but I guess I could pay for extra sauce next time. 

The natural comparison for Rooster & Rice would be to Nong's Khao Man Gai in Portland, which is still the superior hainanese chicken rice, but R&R is still a very solid option for a good lunch that I will be looking forward to coming back to again.

excerpts:
I ordered:
The Original - chicken with the skin, jasmine rice, an extra poached egg, cucumbers, and spicy tangy garlic sauce.
the original.author: Sean W.
the original.review:
Rooster and rice is a basic Asian-styled comfort food establishment in FIDI. They only have 4 menu items, all surprisingly enough focused on chicken and rice, except the vegetarian option! Each entree comes with soup and some spicy sauce. This is a good basic comfort food, although it's a bit on the pricier side ~15$.

The interior is pretty small, they seat about 20 people.

I ordered:
The Original - chicken with the skin, jasmine rice, an extra poached egg, cucumbers, and spicy tangy garlic sauce.

excerpts: So far I've only tried the original (chicken with jasmine white rice), but they also have a healthier version (with brown rice), a vegetarian version (with tofu instead of chicken), and a paleo version (sub rice with veggies).
I'll be sure to come back for one of the healthier options on one of my non-cheat days (:
the original.author: Cindy L.
the original.review:
Where are my 626 homies at? If you're from the 626 and have "Savoy Standards" for hainan chicken (I guess Rooster & Rice is technically the Thai version, but they taste the same to me haha), you definitely have to come check this place out. This place is amazing and checks all the boxes for what good quality hainan chicken should be - fragrant and perfectly cooked rice, tender chicken, and mouthwatering sauce. Their sauce is so bomb that I can eat it with plain white rice, all day everyday. 

The menu is also very "SF friendly". So far I've only tried the original (chicken with jasmine white rice), but they also have a healthier version (with brown rice), a vegetarian version (with tofu instead of chicken), and a paleo version (sub rice with veggies). I'll be sure to come back for one of the healthier options on one of my non-cheat days (:

excerpts: The Original
- It came with thigh and breast part, rice, soup and sauce.
It is simple.
Chicken was boiled and no seasoned.
Rice and soup was little salty.
It was quite good combination.
Taste was same with the original.
the original.author: Da Won L.
the original.review:
Place - Easy to find. Sign board is vivid and easy to read. It is one of restuarant in 303 building. There are few tables inside and lot of tables outside. 

Taste
* The Original - It came with thigh and breast part, rice, soup and sauce. It is simple. Chicken was boiled and no seasoned. Rice and soup was little salty. It was quite good combination. And It tasted really healthy. 

*The Pleo - it came with seasonal veges. I expected several kind of veges but only broccolis. Well, it was disappointed to me. I checked photos of pleo on Yelp. Everyday pleo came with broccolis, no change. If vege is always broccoli, it might be better just writing on board, the pleo comes with brocolis. Taste was same with the original.

Service and Price - Service was good and Price was reasonable.

excerpts: Got The Original chicken rice and it came with--surprise--some really tender chicken and jasmine rice, topped with cucumber and cilantro.
the original.author: Tiffany W.
the original.review:
If you're looking for something fast and simple, you'll love this place. There are only a few menu options, but it's yummy, if a bit overhyped. A little pricy for what you get, but pretty average for SF food. 

Got The Original chicken rice and it came with--surprise--some really tender chicken and jasmine rice, topped with cucumber and cilantro. They also give you a side of clear chicken broth and a ginger/garlic sauce. I highly recommend pouring some of the broth onto the rice and dipping the chicken in the sauce for extra flavor.

There's not much seating inside, but it's very clean and simple. Great option if you're looking for a quick, relatively healthy meal, but didn't entirely live up to the hype.

excerpts: The menu is simple and has 4 options: the original (breast and thigh with skin intact) over white rice, the skinless breast over brown rice, the vegetarian (tofu) over brown rice and seasonal veggies, and the paleo (breast or thigh) over seasonal veggies.
I went with the original and my expectations were exceeded.
the original.author: Annie P.
the original.review:
This was the best khao mun gai (poached chicken and rice) that I've ever had in the US (so far). My favorite Thai street food isn't offered at many restaurants back home, but even if it is -- it just never hit the spot... until I looked up "lunch" in my Yelp app while I was visiting SF and Rooster & Rice popped up.

The menu is simple and has 4 options: the original (breast and thigh with skin intact) over white rice, the skinless breast over brown rice, the vegetarian (tofu) over brown rice and seasonal veggies, and the paleo (breast or thigh) over seasonal veggies. You can also ask for additional chicken, rice, broth, sauces, etc. or even add an egg for a surcharge. The prices range from $9.95 to $12.95. There's several seats inside the restaurant if you're dining in but plenty of outdoor seating as well. They also offer delivery and pickup!

I went with the original and my expectations were exceeded. The chicken was succulent, the rice was pillowy soft and the broth was flavorful. I finished every bite and I'm already looking forward to my next visit when I'm back in SF.

excerpts: Had the Original (breast and thigh with skin on top of jasmine white rice and a side of sauce).
Added a poached egg for $2 more.
The chicken in of itself is nothing special and it tastes healthy cause of the way it's prepared (steamed?).
Not dry at all, but the real star is the side of sauce which is tangy and sweet (almost tastes like a thinner Worcestershire with sugar and ginger).
The rice too was a perfect accompaniment.
the original.author: Jay F.
the original.review: Had the Original (breast and thigh with skin on top of jasmine white rice and a side of sauce). Added a poached egg for $2 more. The chicken in of itself is nothing special and it tastes healthy cause of the way it's prepared (steamed?). Not dry at all, but the real star is the side of sauce which is tangy and sweet (almost tastes like a thinner Worcestershire with sugar and ginger). The rice too was a perfect accompaniment. Tasted like it was cooked in or moistened with chicken broth to give it that extra flavor. The runny egg added that final touch of color, texture, and flavor. Bonus: came in a recyclable container. Minus: tough to find parking in the area but that's all of SF. Overall, recommended and make sure to get extra sauce!

excerpts: I always order the original, and if available, I'll also order a bag of crispy chicken skins.
the original.author: Carolyn Z.
the original.review:
I've been here about 4 times now. I always order the original, and if available, I'll also order a bag of crispy chicken skins. For $11.95 (pre tax, SF mandate, etc.), you get a decent portion of chicken, rice and broth. Normally, I don't like poached chicken because I think it is flavorless. However, the sauce that they provide you makes the chicken taste GREAT! The chicken itself is always moist and the consistency/quality is always there. The rice isn't plain rice. It is quite flavorful, in a subtle way. 

During the lunch rush, there will be lines out the door because it takes them awhile to assemble the chicken bowls in the back. I suggest you come on the earlier end of lunch (think 11am) so that you don't encounter a line and can be in and out in no time. 

If you come with a group, and want to eat there, there are some tables outside as well as some seating inside. For large groups, I recommend you order take out or delivery.

excerpts: I ordered The Original and it is pretty overprice for what it is
(11.95 before tax).
It was a jasmine rice over chicken and it comes with the sauce (what made it good with some hot sauce) and chicken soup.
the original.author: Sherry Y.
the original.review:
Came here on a Friday and there was a line out the door but the line moved quickly. Menu was very simple. I ordered The Original and it is pretty overprice for what it is (11.95 before tax). It was a jasmine rice over chicken and it comes with the sauce (what made it good with some hot sauce) and chicken soup. There wasn't much skin on the chicken as they have fried chicken skin on the menu. 

I also tried the fried chicken skin ($5)and it was meh. It was already cold when my coworker got it but it was a good amount. I could prob only eat a couple. 

Overall the sauce is what made it good but for the price of what it is... I prob wouldn't go back.

excerpts: The menu is pretty simple and I ended up going with the Original, which I believe is #1 on the menu (makes sense right).
The chicken, veggies and rice were all amazing and I ended up inhaling my lunch once I got it back to the office.
It's there amazing sauces that come with the meals based on which you order that really make things come together!
the original.author: Isaiah W.
the original.review:
Got to try this place out during a recent trip to San Francisco, and quickly learned how popular of a lunch spot it is in the city. Luckily, we got there a few minutes before the line went all the way out the door. 

The menu is pretty simple and I ended up going with the Original, which I believe is #1 on the menu (makes sense right). The chicken, veggies and rice were all amazing and I ended up inhaling my lunch once I got it back to the office. It's there amazing sauces that come with the meals based on which you order that really make things come together!

excerpts: I have been here twice and both times I ordered "the original" with brown rice.
It comes with chicken w/ skin (dark + white meat) over a bed of rice and a side of cucumbers.
the original.author: Mandi H.
the original.review:
Great staple lunch spot in SOMA. There's usually a line during the lunch rush but it moves relatively quick. There's some seating inside and outside as well. The menu is super simple which is not a bad thing but there is definitely room for growth. I have been here twice and both times I ordered "the original" with brown rice. It comes with chicken w/ skin (dark + white meat) over a bed of rice and a side of cucumbers. The meal also comes with a yummy broth! The quality of the chicken is amazing and everything tastes fresh. What makes this meal outstanding is the soy sauce which is mixed with garlic and bunch of other good stuff. SO flavorful and unique. 

I always forward to grabbing lunch here. Next time I definitely want to try the coconut drink that comes in an actual coconut!

excerpts: The most popular dish and the one I chose was "The Original" for $11.95: 2 pieces of poached organic chicken, thigh and breast with skin, sliced over a bed of jasmine rice cooked with chicken broth instead of water, topped with cilantro and served with cucumbers and a chili, ginger, garlic and soybean dipping sauce.
I added on a side of veggies (broccoli) for an extra $2.
OH EM GEE, I would come back time an time again for that ginger dipping sauce.
It was one of the best sauces I've had in a while.
the original.author: Rockne H.
the original.review:
I've heard about this place through coworkers for while, so when given the opportunity to grab some lunch here on a Friday afternoon, I quickly jumped on it! 

Don't get me wrong, I think paying about $12 for chicken and rice is a little extravagant but man, you have to try it. To back up a bit, when you arrive, you stand in a line that moves fairly quickly. The staff is super friendly and efficient. The menu, VERY simple so shouldn't take long to decide. There are 4 main dishes to choose from and 7 extras to add on. They also have fried chicken skins at the front for $5 with samples to entice you. 

The most popular dish and the one I chose was "The Original" for $11.95: 2 pieces of poached organic chicken, thigh and breast with skin, sliced over a bed of jasmine rice cooked with chicken broth instead of water, topped with cilantro and served with cucumbers and a chili, ginger, garlic and soybean dipping sauce. I added on a side of veggies (broccoli) for an extra $2. OH EM GEE, I would come back time an time again for that ginger dipping sauce. It was one of the best sauces I've had in a while. The chicken was good, the rice was heaven and add in that dipping sauce to elevate the entire dish from level 4 to 36, and you've got a HUGE flavor dish. 

I now know the reason for the hype. It's completely worth the price and overall, the food is exceptional. Just comes to show, simple ingredients made right and the people will come!

excerpts: The paleo is veggies, the original is with rice.
The overall combination of flavors is simple but so flavorful.
the original.author: Eric Joseph D.
the original.review:
Don't get me wrong, I love pricey SF lunches, but 17 dollars for Chicken and Vegetables? If the flavor wasn't so damn good, I wouldn't keep coming here but 17 for a meal is a little much for what is. 

Despite the price, Rooster and Rice is a very quick and satisfying concept. You choose what pieces of the boiled chicken (leg, thigh, both) you want and add a side. The paleo is veggies, the original is with rice. The overall combination of flavors is simple but so flavorful. Especially with their ginger sauce, you will be addicted. 

Kudos to the staff for bringing rooster and rice to the SOMA area. Not a lot of indoor seating, but there's a good amount of outdoor seating in the beautiful pavilion. The wait is massive during lunch, so highly suggest going after 1!

excerpts: I came here for lunch with coworkers and ordered the Original which has both chicken breast meat and thigh meat.
The chicken was well cooked and tender.
The dipping sauce was tasty and had some ginger flare.
The spicy sauce on the side was spicy but gave the dish and interesting kick.
the original.author: Connie M.
the original.review:
I was a little skeptical to try this place out because I don't know how I feel about pale chicken.

I might be scolded by all the asians on here but I'm not used to eating blanched chicken so it was definitely a new experience for me.

I came here for lunch with coworkers and ordered the Original which has both chicken breast meat and thigh meat. The chicken was well cooked and tender. The dipping sauce was tasty and had some ginger flare. The spicy sauce on the side was spicy but gave the dish and interesting kick. My favorite part of the dish was probably the rice and the side of chicken broth they give you. They probably cook the rice in the chicken stock so it gave it a wonderful flavor and aroma. 

Overall, I think I prefer grilled chicken to boiled chicken. I feel like boiled chicken has a weird chewy texture and the skin creeps me out with the bumps. Also it almost makes the meat taste more gamey if that's even possible.

Fire away! I know I'll get heckled for this one because I don't have quite the seasoned palate for a dish like this.

excerpts: I ordered The Original which contains both breast and thigh meat over jasmine rice, cucumber, broth, and a dipping sauce.
The rice was perfectly cooked and flavored.
I wish they had the option of thigh meat only, but the breast meat wasn't too dry surprisingly!
The cucumbers were refreshing and the dipping sauce paired well with the chicken.
Wish the dipping sauce didn't contain peanuts though!
the original.author: Kristi T.
the original.review:
DELICIOUS! I am a huge fan of Hainan chicken rice and this is pretty delicious even though it isn't exactly the same dish! 

My friend and I dropped in around 1pm on a Wednesday and there was a still a line. The line goes by pretty quick, which is perfect for those with a short lunch break. I ordered The Original which contains both breast and thigh meat over jasmine rice, cucumber, broth, and a dipping sauce. The rice was perfectly cooked and flavored. I wish they had the option of thigh meat only, but the breast meat wasn't too dry surprisingly! The cucumbers were refreshing and the dipping sauce paired well with the chicken. Wish the dipping sauce didn't contain peanuts though! Also, the small cup of soup that came with it was great as well. 

For $13 (after tax) you get quite a lot of food. You could probably stretch this out over 2 meals! The interior is clean, though there isn't much seating. Thankfully, there are some seats available outside. Parking is difficult, which is typical of the area. Will definitely stop by for lunch whenever I'm in the area!

excerpts: I ordered the Original: chicken, rice, cucumber, soybean based sauce, and chicken broth.
Upon first bite, the chicken was tender, healthy tasting, but bland.
I was a little disappointed, but definitely not surprised.
But here's where I got undisappointed: when I tried the sauce!
The sauce is gingery, garlicy, and soybeany.
It complements the chicken and rice so well.
So if you enjoy the sauce, you'll definitely enjoy the chicken!
Similarly to Hainan chicken + rice, the chicken is poached so it's not very flavorful.
the original.author: Yi Xian R.
the original.review:
The food here is extremely aromatic especially when it's being cooked --- It's almost impossible to not want to try this place if you work in the plaza unless you have dietary restrictions or absolutely despise chicken. Every time I smell the chicken, I want to grab Rooster & Rice for lunch! The aroma definitely draws people in. 

However, I was hesitant to try this place because $13+ for what seems like the typical Hainan chicken with rice seems a little crazy to me because I can easily eat Hainan chicken at home for way less than that. But one day, I decided to treat myself to some Rooster & Rice! I wanted to know if the chicken tasted as good as it smelled and I wanted to know if Thai chicken + rice tasted like Hainan chicken + rice! 

AND GUESS WHAT, it did, sorta! 

I ordered the Original: chicken, rice, cucumber, soybean based sauce, and chicken broth. 
Upon first bite, the chicken was tender, healthy tasting, but bland. I was a little disappointed, but definitely not surprised. But here's where I got undisappointed: when I tried the sauce! The sauce is gingery, garlicy, and soybeany. It complements the chicken and rice so well. So if you enjoy the sauce, you'll definitely enjoy the chicken! Similarly to Hainan chicken + rice, the chicken is poached so it's not very flavorful. Sauces are essential to enjoying both chicken + rices! 

For around $15, the meal definitely filled me up just enough. I'll definitely come again when I feel like treating myself.

excerpts: Of the four options the Original was my favorite.
It's a basic boiled chicken with warm rice comfort food.
the original.author: Peter L.
the original.review:
I would go here for the ginger soy sauce dip and the cooked rice - they probably cook the rice in chicken broth instead of water - because both were so good!

Of the four options the Original was my favorite. It's a basic boiled chicken with warm rice comfort food. The Marina is "healthier" since it's skinless chicken with brown rice. The Paleo was good as well but it's just chicken and veggie. All orders come with a cup of chicken broth.

You can add a soft egg to each order but it's not needed unless you really want a runny egg with your meal. They have a dipping Sriracha sauce blend if you want a kick.

Go around 12:45pm or later and avoid the lunch crowd line. Be prepared to wait after ordering though.

excerpts: Without further thoughts, I came in and ordered The Original.
the original.author: Bennett W.
the original.review:
Rooster & Rice is awesome. I felt the need to get a bowl of rice and chicken with an egg on top. Without further thoughts, I came in and ordered The Original. This bowl contained rice, chicken, cucumber, cilantro and sauce dip with an egg on top.

There may be a long line especially when coming here for lunch during the week. However, I do want to admit that it does move fast which is always a good thing. Seating is limited inside, but there are more seats available outside. Rooster & Rice is a good spot for something to eat before or after the gym.

I also admit the entire meal is delicious and will come back again to try the other bowls.

excerpts: Tried the Original.
Really good Hainanese Chicken!
They call it Thai
the original.author: Joseph L.
the original.review:
Tried the Original. Really good Hainanese Chicken! They call it Thai but I think they taste just like those well-executed Hainanese Chicken Rice I've had in Singapore. 

It's slightly pricey for a workday lunch, but given they cook their chicken so well, I'm willing to eat here every so often.

Make sure you grab some of the hot sauce on the side. They go really well with the chicken!

excerpts: I went with the original, which is skin-on chicken over white rice, and a delicious garlic sauce that I suggest you use generously.
The chicken is so incredibly tender and tastes incredibly comforting with the rice.
My only critique is that everything could've been hotter (the chicken was lukewarm).
A tad overpriced at about $13 for lunch, but not bad for SF standards.
The line gets long during the weekday lunch hour, but moves fast!
the original.author: Chloe Z.
the original.review: What an ingenious idea for a quick, healthy, delicious lunch joint!  I went with the original, which is skin-on chicken over white rice, and a delicious garlic sauce that I suggest you use generously. The chicken is so incredibly tender and tastes incredibly comforting with the rice. My only critique is that everything could've been hotter (the chicken was lukewarm). A tad overpriced at about $13 for lunch, but not bad for SF standards. The line gets long during the weekday lunch hour, but moves fast!

excerpts: "The Original" which is soooo delicious.
Love how limited this menu is.
They specialize in just a few things, and you can add a few extras on top of whatever you order.
Each dish comes with a small bowl of chicken soup.
Hot, fresh, and tasty.
The chicken and rice comes with a side of garlic and ginger sauce, which is the perfect degree of seasoning.
You can also drench everything with the hot sauce available.
the original.author: Stefanie C.
the original.review:
I had actually been thinking (read: dreaming) about the Marina location of Rooster & Rice recently and wanted to go back. One day while running errands in SoMa, I Yelped a place for lunch and discovered that Rooster & Rice opened up another location nearby! Jackpot!! It was in the middle of the lunch rush, but I think enough people are unaware of the awesomeness that is Rooster & Rice, so it wasn't too much of a wait. 

Of course, I got the Khao Mun Gai "The Original" which is soooo delicious. Love how limited this menu is. They specialize in just a few things, and you can add a few extras on top of whatever you order. Each dish comes with a small bowl of chicken soup. Hot, fresh, and tasty. The chicken and rice comes with a side of garlic and ginger sauce, which is the perfect degree of seasoning. You can also drench everything with the hot sauce available. Gives it a nice kick. 

Rooster & Rice is one of my favorite lunch spots in the city. I'm never in the Marina, so this SoMa location is quite a blessing. There's plenty of seating outside in the plaza. On a sunny San Francisco day, the greenery and fountain are gorgeous. There's also some seating inside -- more than the Marina location -- but I prefer sitting outdoors while enjoying this warm and cozy meal.

excerpts: I got the original, with both white and dark meat.
Garish with cucumbers.
You can add veggies of the day for extra $3.
the original.author: Sandy B.
the original.review:
New to SOMA and that sauce is AMAZING! made with fresh chili, ginger, garlic and soybean sauce, absolutely delicious! And the rice was cook perfectly. I can just eat the rice and the sauce alone. Yum! I got the original, with both white and dark meat. Garish with cucumbers. You can add veggies of the day for extra $3. Small menu but its great because chicken and rice is all you need. 

I got there at 1:10pm and there was no wait. I ordered my food and got my order in under 5 mins. Quick and efficient. There is also outside and inside seating.

excerpts: The time I went, I got the original with an egg.
The original comes with a nice amount of chicken, rice, some cucumbers, a cup of soup, and a small container of soybean sauce.
the original.author: Ed W.
the original.review:
Khao Mun Gai for the first time! It's amazingly delicious. The time I went, I got the original with an egg. The original comes with a nice amount of chicken, rice, some cucumbers, a cup of soup, and a small container of soybean sauce. 

While I didn't end up eating my food here, I will begin by looking at the ambience of the location. The ambience seems pretty modern. Your experience begins when you enter the front doors and you see a pretty minimal menu, which in my books is an A+, since minimal menus allow for less "decision fatigue". I also liked the interior design, since the colors weren't very distracting from the whole experience (yes, my whole experience of waiting for my food to-go haha). There is also a courtyard outside of this restaurant, giving you another option if you think the indoor seating is too claustrophobic. 

On to the food! I think what stood out the most to me was the soup; there was just so much flavor, that I probably would have been happy if I had just drunk that (well flavor-wise). The soybean sauce (from which I tasted garlic and ginger, as some of the more prominent flavors) was also something worth mentioning, as it gave an interesting kick to the chicken. 

All in all, I would definitely come back here again, and probably more often too, if it weren't a 15 minute walk away from my workplace.


Photo I took (Instagram):
https://www.instagram.com/p/BYytElLBObT (Original)
https://www.instagram.com/p/BasPORrBBej/
https://www.instagram.com/p/BcGFCpFB48E/

excerpts: My SF cynicism expected a gentrified version that would lose the original flavors and toss in random avocados and stuff (I do laugh at their poached egg option), but the complex flavors and superb quality exceeded my expectations.
My favorite turned out to be the rice: the robust, fragrant chicken flavoring was memorable, and the unconventional amount of al dente-ness was a pleasant surprise.
The sauce brought everything together in layers of sweet soy sauce blended with ginger, scallions, beans, and chili.
the original.author: Edna C.
the original.review:
Rooster & Rice's expansion into the FiDi was clever, especially in time for the Year of the Rooster. After all, which millennial wouldn't be able to resist an expensive but photogenic lunch with a clever fitting Instagram caption! (Yes I am aware that I am making fun of myself)

R&R illustrates my love-hate relationship with the SF food scene--it's delicious, wholesome, high-quality, global-inspired, but borders on downright unaffordable. My counter-service lunch of chicken over rice with sauce, cucumbers, and broccoli (an extra $2) totaled to $15.18! In Asia, you could probably serve the same dish to a small family at the same cost. 

Price rants aside, R&R creates an excellent rendition of Hainan chicken rice. My SF cynicism expected a gentrified version that would lose the original flavors and toss in random avocados and stuff (I do laugh at their poached egg option), but the complex flavors and superb quality exceeded my expectations. My favorite turned out to be the rice: the robust, fragrant chicken flavoring was memorable, and the unconventional amount of al dente-ness was a pleasant surprise. The sauce brought everything together in layers of sweet soy sauce blended with ginger, scallions, beans, and chili. I also opted for some habanero sauce (mainly to make my picture look more colorful), which added a mild creaminess.

Because of the distractingly good sauces, I found it difficult to evaluate the chicken itself. The chicken in this dish is always intentionally plain so you can fully appreciate the chicken essence. I think the use of Mary's chicken inherently has a different chicken-ness compared to the "yellow-haired chicken" (黃毛雞) traditionally used, so it's difficult to evaluate the poaching technique. The chicken broth was richly flavored and steamy, the perfect heart-warming addition to any lunch in chilly SF days.

Note that although it ins't your typical greasy food, the liberal use of chicken fat and various sauces make it a more filling lunch than you'd expect from a chicken meal. For me, it also left a bit of a salty aftertaste.

The space is hipster--upbeat almost-rap-like music, impressive arrangements of succulents, communal tables of course. Outside there's a beautiful public open space courtyard. 

The verdict? Yummy food, quite authentic, with a Californian flair, but at Marina prices.

excerpts: We got the original and were both very impressed.
Portions were generous.
Chicken was tender and flavorful.
the original.author: Grace J.
the original.review:
YESSSS. Kao mun gai is my favorite Thai dish ever (and is very much a staple meal choice in Thailand) but sadly is not that well known or offered in Thai restaurants in the US. I'm so glad Rooster & Rice opened a second location close to where I work to share this amazingness with America! My cousin and I are both of Thai descent and went to this restaurant to see what the hype was about. Actually I was just really craving some kao mun gai and Rooster & Rice delivered! 

We got the original and were both very impressed. Portions were generous. Chicken was tender and flavorful. The rice, OH THE RICE, gave off a light, fragrant scent of jasmine combined with the mouth watering flavor of chicken broth. The highlight and real test was THE SAUCE. This is always the trickiest part to get right but the portions of the ingredients really hit the spot. Sigh... I love kao mun gai. 

We came the day after opening around lunch time so there was a delay in getting our orders out - I think they were waiting for the rice to cook. The owners acknowledged the delay and even offered to give us a free drink, but their generosity and that acknowledgement was all I needed. Thanks for being awesome and opening your doors to SOMA!

Pros
-Kao mun gai, duh!

Cons
-Kinda pricey, but it's soo goood

excerpts: I ordered the original with white rice and it came with a little cup of soup.
the original.author: Angela P.
the original.review:
Great place to eat if you're looking for something healthy!

I came here for dinner and there was basically no wait but I do hear lunch time gets pretty packed. I ordered the original with white rice and it came with a little cup of soup. If you want any add ons though, be prepared to pay 30% more...

However, overall it was very simple and filling! The soy bean sauce paired very well with the chicken and rice combo. The rice was very flavorful and the chicken had a good texture.  Overall a good meal! The downside is that it is relatively expensive for just chicken and rice but that's kind of the norm with restaurants in SOMA.

excerpts: The original bowl come with chicken & white jasmine rice, the Marina comes with brown, and there is also a vegetarian option that subs the chicken with organic tofu.
You can also do add ons for a few dollars more, such as adding an egg.
It's a great healthy lunch option or even post-workout meal.
Over all it's a bit pricey for a meal, but the quality and portion sizes are worth it.
the original.author: Joy W.
the original.review:
As the name suggests, the specialities of this place are chicken & rice.

I got the Paleo Bowl which came with chicken, seasonal veggies (broccoli when I went), cucumbers, and a cup of chicken broth. I got a mix of thigh & breast meat, and my it was so unbelievably tender. The chicken flavorful and super juicy. The price is a bit steep since it was $12.95 and after tax, about $14. However, they use organic Mary's chicken and the chicken was indeed a enormous portion. The broth was super flavorful and tasted like the kind of broth my mom would stew with chicken bones and make me drink when I was sick as a kid. Definitely use the ginger garlic soybean dipping sauce that comes with it too!

The original bowl come with chicken & white jasmine rice, the Marina comes with brown, and there is also a vegetarian option that subs the chicken with organic tofu. You can also do add ons for a few dollars more, such as adding an egg. It's a great healthy lunch option or even post-workout meal. Over all it's a bit pricey for a meal, but the quality and portion sizes are worth it.

excerpts: I've had both the original and paleo which was both served with chicken broth and cucumbers.
(Can't go wrong with either chicken breast or chicken thigh) I personally love when dishes are served with a bit of freshly cut cucumbers, makes the meal taste clean and fresh.
Their side of ginger sauce is lightly sweet and perfect to pour over the whole dish or dip separately.
They also have a sriracha (standard) and a habanero sauce.
the original.author: Christine T.
the original.review:
This place is simply delicious! Great for lunch, they are super quick and nice service. Their poached chicken is perfectly cooked (I hate when you chew chicken and two seconds later it becomes saw dust in your mouth.) they give you about 6-8 oz. of chicken. I've had both the original and paleo which was both served with chicken broth and cucumbers. (Can't go wrong with either chicken breast or chicken thigh) I personally love when dishes are served with a bit of freshly cut cucumbers, makes the meal taste clean and fresh. Their side of ginger sauce is lightly sweet and perfect to pour over the whole dish or dip separately. They also have a sriracha (standard) and a habanero sauce. The habanero sauce is definitely spicey but not overbearing which gives the dish a really nice kick to it. 

The place is small, but there is a ton of seating outside and on a nice day, it's generally preferred. For $13, I'd say it's worth it. I always feel full, but not the gross kind of full that makes you feel sluggish and want a nap after. This place is definitely my go to lunch spot.

excerpts: The Original = breast & thigh skin-on with Jasmine white rice.
Tender and juicy breast and thigh--they're both so good.
Habanero sauce in addition to their awesome (chili, ginger, garlic & soybean) sauce makes this chicken & rice dish even more epic.
the original.author: Fannie S.
the original.review:
Food = good. Fresh and clean tasting.

The Original = breast & thigh skin-on with Jasmine white rice. Tender and juicy breast and thigh--they're both so good. Habanero sauce in addition to their awesome (chili, ginger, garlic & soybean) sauce makes this chicken & rice dish even more epic. Chicken broth comes with the entree and it's delicious. Piping hot, not crazy salty and actually tastes like, well, chicken. $11.95. 

I added an egg. Because why not. $2.00. 

They also have fried chicken skins ($5.00) but they were out after 1 p.m. Maybe next time... 

Service = friendly at the counter. Everything else is self-service. And almost everything is compostable/biodegradable.

Prices = moderate. Lunch came out to $15.14. Probably would've had leftovers if I hadn't waited so long to have lunch. There's plenty to eat though.

excerpts: I'm partial to the original.
Each of the ingredients are incredibly flavorful and complement each other well.
the original.author: Daniel M.
the original.review:
This is an instant favorite. I'm not really into the healthy food craze (mainly because most places I've tried really sacrifice on taste and/or service), but this is just one of the best restaurants I've tried recently, healthy or otherwise.

They have a simple menu, matching the simple and modern layout of the location. I think that's good because it keeps things simple, but refined and focused. 

I'm partial to the original. Each of the ingredients are incredibly flavorful and complement each other well. They don't skimp on portions either, which means you'll be satisfied at the end of your meal. 

There may be a bit of a line depending on when you visit, but they get the meals out quickly. 

It's a little more expensive than I want to pay for a regular meal, but the quality is well worth it. If you're looking for something new, healthy, and quick, definitely check this place out.

excerpts: We ended up grabbing the Original with double chicken which was a nice amount on top of what already comes with.
Pretty good food.
Good rice.
Good soup.
Chicken is cool, however my chicken was cold.
Everything else was hot, even my girlfriend's full plate was hot.
I was disappointed that my chicken was cold.
the original.author: John M.
the original.review:
This spot is absolutely, 100% different in almost every way from their Marina location. Super nice decor, much much more seating, white walls, and even fresh coconuts (never seen them at other location). Cater to your customers though. 

We ended up grabbing the Original with double chicken which was a nice amount on top of what already comes with. Pretty good food. Good rice. Good soup. Chicken is cool, however my chicken was cold. Everything else was hot, even my girlfriend's full plate was hot. I was disappointed that my chicken was cold. I wanted to say something but the guy behind the register kept disappearing behind the wall so wasn't sure if he was cashier/chef/clean-up crew. 

Besides the chicken being cold I like this spot. 3 stars for that.

excerpts: I ordered the original both times.
The meat is so moist and the sauce that comes with it is BOMB.
Would highly recommend this!
the original.author: Michelle L.
the original.review:
This place is AMAZING. Not sure if it's because of the nostalgia this dish brings to me (my family cooked this my whole life) or if it's just that damn good but I had it twice on my trip to San Francisco even though I had a long list of places I wanted to visit. It's just THAT good. 

I ordered the original both times. The meat is so moist and the sauce that comes with it is BOMB. Would highly recommend this!

excerpts: My companion and I ordered the original rooster bowl and a vegetarian bowl.
They come with little cups of soup on the side!
the original.author: Jane H.
the original.review:
This place has a very simple menu, which I like. Chicken and rice, that's it (save for a vegetarian option).

My companion and I ordered the original rooster bowl and a vegetarian bowl. They come with little cups of soup on the side! My chicken broth was light and delicious.

At first glance, the chicken looks cold and flavorless, but looks can be deceiving. The meat was very tender, but the sauce was the real star, mixed with a little of the habanero sauce for a spicy kick. Very good. The only thing I didn't really like was the skin that they left on the meat- I'm not a big fan of chewy skin but to teach their own.

 The veggie bowl was fine, but the chicken was better imo. Also we ordered an extra egg, which turned out to be poached, not fried. The eggs were kind of inconsistent in that one still had a runny yolk, while the other was completely solidified. A little weird, but it didn't really bother me.

The seating is very minimal. Server was very nice and polite, but it took a while to get our order. Overall, probably a 4.5.

excerpts: The original chicken rice tastes good.
The chicken soup that comes with the main dish is delicious too.
I would recommend.
the original.author: Yinrong L.
the original.review: The original chicken rice tastes good. The chicken soup that comes with the main dish is delicious too. I would recommend.

excerpts: The chicken: I ordered "The Original" and the cashier kindly let me substitute brown rice.
The chicken was good!
Big portion!
Well poached!
Would have been a LOT better if the chicken had been topped off with the cilantro that appears on every damn photo on Yelp and on the R&R website.
I love cilantro.
the original.author: Jon P.
the original.review:
The chicken: I ordered "The Original" and the cashier kindly let me substitute brown rice. The chicken was good! Big portion! Well poached! Would have been a LOT better if the chicken had been topped off with the cilantro that appears on every damn photo on Yelp and on the R&R website. I love cilantro. But... cilantro, denied.

The brown rice: Big portion, freshly prepared. Would have been better with cilantro. I fell for the old "Cilantro Bait & Switch" and it hurt.

The dipping sauce: Awesome, awesome. Love the generous amounts of ginger. Oh, hey, I think I saw a fleck of cilantro in the sauce. Nice try, R&R, but you still owe me a generous helping of cilantro. 

It's a pricey lunch, but for healthfully prepared chicken, brown rice, and killer sauce, it's a great high-protein/good-carb meal. But I'm keeping a cilantro ledger, and R&R is in the RED.

excerpts: My go to order is The Original ($12) plus a poached egg ($2).
The runny egg over rice just makes it that much better.
the original.author: Vijay S.
the original.review:
Rooster and Rice serves hainan style chicken and rice. It's a really simple poached chicken dish with some fragrant rice and sauce (soy, ginger and garlic). Besides the vegetarian option, each dish comes with a side of chicken broth. The place is pretty small and gets crowded during lunch so it's better to order it to go. 

It's simple but man do they do it well, it's one of those comfort foods that you can have every day and not really get bored of it. 

My go to order is The Original ($12) plus a poached egg ($2). The runny egg over rice just makes it that much better. They have a house habanero sauce that packs a nice kick that I add as well.

I know people complain about the price being high, but being in SF and comparing it to a $15 salad, it really isn't that bad. My only complaint is that it's not closer to where I work. 

Tip:
Some days they fry up the chicken skins and have it available for $5, if you're with a group it is worth sharing

excerpts: I love "The Original" and
"The Paleo" w/ an egg.
The chicken soup they always give out as a side is delicious too.
the original.author: Angel C.
the original.review:
Great lunch spot in SOMA!

I have heard people raving about this place long before I tried it out myself. To be honest, I was very skeptical about this back then, but now I'm hooked! The photos do not do them justice. Yes, it might look kind of bland. Yes, it might seem somewhat small-portioned. But the chicken and rice combo tastes wonderful and is surprisingly fulfilling. I love "The Original" and "The Paleo" w/ an egg. The chicken soup they always give out as a side is delicious too. It does tend to be pricier than other lunch places in the area (~$13-15), but I would say it's worth to try out.

P.S. I find the actual restaurant area smell really funny, but none of my coworkers are picking up on that... so it might just be me. Food is great though!

excerpts: I ordered the original with dark meat only and added an egg.
the original.author: Victoria L.
the original.review:
Yum!  As the restaurant's name suggests, this place literally has only rice and chicken haha.  The location is tucked away in the plaza so it was nice and quiet when we came in around 3p. 

I ordered the original with dark meat only and added an egg.  The dish came with soy sauce mix on the side and a bowl of chicken broth. I was nervous to pour the entire cup of soy sauce but it worked out perfectly. To my surprise, the dish wasn't too salty even with all the soy sauce.  I'm glad I chose to get all dark meat because the meat came out juicy and flavorful (not dry at all).  The addition of the egg gave the rice a creamy texture -not creamy in a weird way.  The cucumber and cilantro gave the dish a refreshing kick. If I were to get this dish next time, I would opt to get it without the skin. I wasn't a fan of the mushy skin (for some reason I thought the skin would be crunchy lmao).  The chicken broth went soo well with the rice. Such an Asian combo :) aka the rice x broth. I never knew this was a Thai dish and I'm glad a place like this exists!  Overall, Rooster and Rice was very memorable!  10/10 recommend. 

Oh, grab a Thai tea while you're at it!

excerpts: Order the original with white rice, the marina with brown rice, the paleo with seasonal veggies in lieu of rice or the vegetarian, tofu in lieu of that chicken.
the original.author: Stephanie Y.
the original.review:
The lines will be long, but it goes by fast and it's worth it, yo!

You will be spending about $15+ on lunch though, no doubt. But that lunch will be filled with juicy, healthy chicken on a bed of delicious rice served with a little cup of bone broth. Healthy, filling and oh so satisfying. What gets ya is the additional add-on's, pricewise. Want extra veggies? $3. Want an egg? $3. Goodbye are the days of cheap eats for lunch.

Order the original with white rice, the marina with brown rice, the paleo with seasonal veggies in lieu of rice or the vegetarian, tofu in lieu of that chicken.

They have a tasty soy based sauce to pour on and don't forget your little cups of sriracha or what looks to be housemade habanero. If you're gonna drop $15+ on lunch, this is a great option.

Plenty of outside seating both with tables and chairs, but also some funky seating in the courtyard; perfect for a sunny San Francisco day.

excerpts: We all had the original, chicken breast and thigh with skin over jasmine rice, which also comes with a small bowl of delicious soup.
The chicken itself was incredibly tender and flavorful, and even better with the ginger sauce that comes with it (even though I had to pick out all the leaves of cilantro).
the original.author: KC W.
the original.review:
Finally got to try Rooster & Rice after having the Marina location bookmarked for months, and I was not disappointed! Came here with my friends one rainy day for lunch and it was completely packed - we ended up taking our food to go because there was nowhere to sit. We all had the original, chicken breast and thigh with skin over jasmine rice, which also comes with a small bowl of delicious soup. The chicken itself was incredibly tender and flavorful, and even better with the ginger sauce that comes with it (even though I had to pick out all the leaves of cilantro). There are also two more sauces you can serve yourself, but the spicy orange one is better than the red tangy one. 

The price was pretty reasonable especially considering portion size because I was quite full after devouring the entire box. I just wish they had a bigger space with more seating, but there are many public spaces in the area where you can take your food to go. Though the menu is very simple, the quality of food is top notch and well worth the wait. Definitely will be back in the future to satisfy my Hainan chicken cravings!

excerpts: so I rushed in and quickly ordered The Original to go.
I was a bit skeptical of the chicken here once I found out it was boneless, since I love dark meat and find the meat around the bone to be the most juicy and flavorful.
Also, when my meal came out to be $13 flat after tax without adding any extras such as veggies or egg, I thought to myself, "This better be good.
The Original comes with a bed of fragrant jasmine chicken rice, pieces of cucumber, some broth, and a soy based sauce with soybeans, ginger, garlic, and chili.
They provide a good amount of meat which consists of both white breast meat and dark thigh meat.
The meat is boneless, but has skin on it.
The chicken turned out to be some of the most juicy chicken meat I've ever had.
There was not a single piece of dry chicken to be found and each bite was a succulent artistic work that artists like Van Gogh and Ringo Starr could only dream of.
It's just so wonderful to have such delicious boneless chicken meat since it isn't messy to eat and is also easy to eat which is great for a quick workday lunch.
The rice is filled with the savory umami flavor from the chicken to make it the idea carb to complement the meat.
The cucumber adds a contrast to all the umami flavor by adding a bit of sweetness to the meal\.
The refreshing nature of it pairs very well with the chicken especially when the chicken is dipped in their habanero or thai sriracha sauce for a spicy kick.
Their soy based sauce adds so many wonderful flavors with the chicken.
The fragrance of the ginger with the saltiness of the soy sauce help to accentuate the natural flavors of the chicken rather than detract from it.
the original.author: Joshua M.
the original.review:
IT'S SOOOOOOOOO GOOOOOD!!!

But seriously though, I just finished it a few minutes ago and now I have very conflicting feelings. I'm super happy because I just had an amazing lunch. I'm also super sad because I'm done and there's no more. Are these tears tears of joy or tears of sadness, or am I just crying because my sneaky ninja coworkers are cutting onions again? Is this how Anton Ego felt when he took his first bite of that ratatouille? Well, in Whoville they say that the Grinch's small heart grew three sizes that day.

Rooster & Rice, located as part of the nice plaza at 303 2nd Street, is a small little restaurant that specializes in Khao Mun Gai which is also known as Hainanese Chicken. If you love Hainanese chicken, you'll for sure love the chicken here. If you're not sure if you love Hainanese chicken, then this might just be the place you fall in love with it.

I've passed by this place a couple times with an intention of trying it out, but I typically find a long line here around noon so I end up opting for something else. However, on this Friday afternoon, I noticed there wasn't a line so I rushed in and quickly ordered The Original to go. I was a bit skeptical of the chicken here once I found out it was boneless, since I love dark meat and find the meat around the bone to be the most juicy and flavorful. Also, when my meal came out to be $13 flat after tax without adding any extras such as veggies or egg, I thought to myself, "This better be good."

The Original comes with a bed of fragrant jasmine chicken rice, pieces of cucumber, some broth, and a soy based sauce with soybeans, ginger, garlic, and chili. They provide a good amount of meat which consists of both white breast meat and dark thigh meat. The meat is boneless, but has skin on it. The chicken turned out to be some of the most juicy chicken meat I've ever had. There was not a single piece of dry chicken to be found and each bite was a succulent artistic work that artists like Van Gogh and Ringo Starr could only dream of. It's just so wonderful to have such delicious boneless chicken meat since it isn't messy to eat and is also easy to eat which is great for a quick workday lunch. The rice is filled with the savory umami flavor from the chicken to make it the idea carb to complement the meat. The cucumber adds a contrast to all the umami flavor by adding a bit of sweetness to the meal\. The refreshing nature of it pairs very well with the chicken especially when the chicken is dipped in their habanero or thai sriracha sauce for a spicy kick. Their soy based sauce adds so many wonderful flavors with the chicken. The fragrance of the ginger with the saltiness of the soy sauce help to accentuate the natural flavors of the chicken rather than detract from it. If all this wasn't good enough, the chicken broth on the side provides an aspect of warmth to the meal, reminding me of homemade chicken soup that could heat up a home on a cold winter day and help heal the sick.

Needless to say, I'm a huge fan of Rooster & Chicken and if you're in the area looking for lunch, this restaurant is surely a solid choice!

excerpts: I ordered the original and it was definitely not lacking in size.
The portions are perfect if you are a heavy eater like myself!
the original.author: Mai W.
the original.review:
Came here for lunch but wished they were open for dinner as well!!!

Although a simple chicken and rice dish, the flavors were there!!! The ginger soy sauce is to die for as many yelpers have suggested. There seems to always be a long line but it does go fast. 

I ordered the original and it was definitely not lacking in size. The portions are perfect if you are a heavy eater like myself!

excerpts: I ordered The Original for myself.
The chicken in the bowl was lean yet very tender and flavorful.
My boyfriend ordered The Marina because he doesn't like when chicken is fatty or has skin, but I actually think that he would've been just as happy with The Original.
The chicken in The Original (even the thigh) was just as lean, and I actually didn't get any skin in my bowl.
That last part might be a big negative to some, but I didn't mind much.
the original.author: Sara L.
the original.review:
Thought that the khao mun gai here was a homey, comforting, and satisfying meal. 

I ordered The Original for myself. The chicken in the bowl was lean yet very tender and flavorful. My boyfriend ordered The Marina because he doesn't like when chicken is fatty or has skin, but I actually think that he would've been just as happy with The Original. The chicken in The Original (even the thigh) was just as lean, and I actually didn't get any skin in my bowl. That last part might be a big negative to some, but I didn't mind much. The broth was good too. Full of flavor, and not heavy or oily.

The jasmine rice was like the rice that's usually included in Hainan chicken dishes, in that it was very flavorful on its own. For that reason, don't dump the whole sauce container over the rice! The sauce is SUPER delicious, but if you put too much into the bowl, it can overpower the flavors of the chicken and the rice. Same goes for the optional Thai sriracha and the habanero sauce that they offer. SO good, but be careful how much you use because the bowl is far from bland even without them. 

Would this be 5 stars if this was cheaper? Definitely. In fact, I have no doubt that the same dish could be as little as half the price in Thai restaurants located elsewhere, like LA or Thailand itself. But let's be real: This is San Francisco. This is where many people don't think twice about dropping $15 for a simple salad. So Rooster & Rice isn't cheap, but I wouldn't say it's overpriced.

With that said, I really enjoyed the food here, and I'm happy that they opened this SoMa location.

excerpts: I have only gotten the original, but for me that's all I need!
Friend got the paleo and it felt like there was a lot more chicken, but I could be wrong, as I easily finished mine while she took a while to eat.
the original.author: Serena W.
the original.review: New favorite chicken comfort food place. Been here twice and I am a huge fan of the place already!! The sauce is delicious (I am a big ginger fan but even if you're not, you'll still like its sweetness). The chicken is nice and tender. You can sub brown rice for white at no extra charge. I have only gotten the original, but for me that's all I need! Friend got the paleo and it felt like there was a lot more chicken, but I could be wrong, as I easily finished mine while she took a while to eat. The broth soup it comes with is 10/10. It warms me from the inside out. I'm willing to pay the money for this place, which must mean it's GOOD. Will come again!

excerpts: I had the Original and the Marina.
Marina has brown rice and no skin on the chicken .
The original has white rice and skin on some pieces of the chicken.
I always call in so I can stand in line versus ordering there.
the original.author: Stephanie C.
the original.review: My girlfriend told me about this location.  This is my second time and now I know how to order.  I had the Original and the Marina.  Marina has brown rice and no skin on the chicken .  The original has white rice and skin on some pieces of the chicken.  I always call in so I can stand in line versus ordering there.  I love their broth as there is no MSG in it.  I wish there were more veggies with the meal.  Thank is why I am giving a 4 star.

excerpts: I like the healthy customization, but if you want the true khao mun gai experience, you should try the Original option, with the poached/boiled chicken and the oh-so-delicious chicken fat rice.
the original.author: Kate M.
the original.review:
Finally, a decent place to get khao mun gai in SF! Kao mun gai, or the Thai verson ofHainan chicken rice, is one of the most popular street food in Singapore, and despite its extremely simple premise, is super flavorful. The secret is the super flavorful rice, flavored with chicken broth, chicken fat, oil, and whatever sauce you include, such as garlic.
