What I appreciate about this location is that it faces a fairly large plaza with a water fountain, a few dozen tables, and pillars around the water fountain where you can sit. 

The location itself is pretty small - don't expect to sit inside to eat your meal, unless you want to deal with dozens of customers standing around waiting for their order. The line itself goes pretty fast, but expect to wait around 15-30 minutes if you go anytime between 12-1pm (aka rush hour for lunch). The servers are friendly, and do their best to get your order across, and yell out order numbers despite the place getting super crowded.

The menu is simple - choose between skin or skinless chicken, breast or thigh (or some combination), and white rice, brown rice or just broccoli. You can even opt to get half/half (i usually go for half brown rice, half broccoli). 

The chicken itself is actually very tasty, considering they simply boil it. I highly recommend sipping the chicken broth that comes with it, as it starts to get dry. They also offer sriracha and spicy sauce to change up the flavor, although it does come with this soy sauce. 

With tax, your meal usually comes out to around $15. As expected, eating in the city, but admittedly a bit steeper than I would want in a simple and healthy meal.

excerpts: The chicken always tastes fresh and tender, and the broth that the meal comes with is the perfect addition (especially on a cold day or if you're sick).
Definitely add their habanero sauce if you're a fan of spicy food!
broth.author: Alice C.
broth.review:
I can't believe I've been here so many times and haven't written a review yet! This is one of my go-to lunch places because it's so delicious and healthy. It's just chicken and rice (+ a few cucumbers and cilantro), but they somehow make it taste amazing.

I usually get The Original, but the options only get healthier from there, with The Paleo being the healthiest. The rice is unbelievable, and I have no idea how they season it so well but it's probably my favorite part of the meal. The chicken always tastes fresh and tender, and the broth that the meal comes with is the perfect addition (especially on a cold day or if you're sick). Definitely add their habanero sauce if you're a fan of spicy food! That and the ginger soy sauce it comes with go really well together.

There's always a line at lunch, so come before 12 or after 1 if you don't want to wait very long. There's some seating inside, but there's plenty of seating at the center of the plaza, which I would recommend if it's a nice day out!

excerpts: It comes with cucumber and cilantro garnish and a clear chicken broth.
broth.author: Darien R.
broth.review:
I had the chance to try Hainan Chicken or Hainanese Chicken in Singapore a few years back.  It was outstanding.  We all loved it and couldn't get it out of our minds.  I think the Thai also have a similar dish by the name of Khao Mun Gai.  Come to think of it, I think the Chinese also have a poached chicken dish that is somewhat similar.  Seems like every culture has a version of this dish!

Since that trip, we've been trying to find some authentic-tasting Hainan Chicken here in the States and it's been difficult.  You can find it, it's just hard to find it done right.

I love the simplicity of the dish, the bare, skinless chicken and that garlic and ginger infused broken rice.  It's so light and refreshing.

THE ORIGINAL (5/5) I ordered "The Original" which included thigh meat along with breast.  I asked if I could have *only* breast and they accommodated.  I *almost* ordered the soft boiled egg as an extra but decided I wanted to just have it plain the first time around. It comes with cucumber and cilantro garnish and a clear chicken broth.  I was craving spice!

It was so delicious - the meat is so tender and that sauce goes so well with the chicken.  The rice is like crack-cocaine, you just can't stop eating it (not that I've ever tried crack-cocaine)!!  The rice, with that chicken, and that sauce is such a magical combination.  I can completely understand why this restaurant has made the choice to sell only this dish!

Love this place.  Love the concept.  Love their food.

excerpts: Other than that, chicken is good, broth is good, chicken fat rice is good, and sometimes the cravings exceed my frugality.
broth.author: Stephanie Joyce D.
broth.review:
Rooster & Rice is a treat yo self lunch for me. Not in the sense that I never pay $15 for lunch, but moreso in that I don't think $15 for chicken & vegetables (the PALEO) is justified.

Nevertheless, I find myself eating here because I'm addicted to the sauce(s). The sauce they serve with their khao mun gai is some sort of mix between two popular Thai street sauces, nam jim tao jiew & nam jim hai lam. You can find recipes for one or the other on the interwebs, but R&R's particular concoction boggles my mind with it's bewildering proportion of chili, ginger, garlic and fermented soybean. Sometimes I want to pay the extra $1 and take sauce for home. But not only that! The SRIRACHA here is the best I've ever had, and I'm not as obsessed with sriracha as everyone else seems to be. I've scoured Asian markets, even Thai markets, for this particular brand. No such luck so I can only get my fix here :( The habanero sauce is also pretty damn delicious, and I find myself dipping amongst the three in more rotation than I would salsas at a taqueria. Seriously so addicting.

I almost strayed from trying this place because I have a Thai friend who did not give her stamp of approval. I guess it was inevitable that I'd one day walk into this newer SoMa location because it's walkable from me and I'm lazy af. Glad I did because now Rooster & Rice is one of my usual lunch options.

I really just wish they'd lower their prices. To put it into perspective, for a few more dollars you can get khao mun gai for lunch at the Michelin-starred Kin Khao. Rooster & Rice is even counter service, and you can definitely find cheaper, more complex uses of organic Mary's chicken at plenty of other fast casual restaurants. It's not even like they put any effort into their decor/ambience, and they literally have a max of 2 people working at a time. I REALLY JUST DON'T GET THEIR PRICE POINT. I'm willing to bet their business would do so much better if the owners would just get off their high horse. Other than that, chicken is good, broth is good, chicken fat rice is good, and sometimes the cravings exceed my frugality.

excerpts: Served with a fresh chili, ginger, garlic and soybean sauce and a side of chicken broth.
I amped the flavors up to 11 by dousing the chicken in habanero sauce.
broth.author: Matthew C.
broth.review:
Simplicity is key at Rooster & Rice. The incredibly minimal menu specializes in Khao Mun Gai, poached chicken on top of jasmine rice. At first glance, that might not sound all that sexy, but trust me, it's sexy!

A line out the door on a Tuesday afternoon took around 10 minutes to get up to the front. The tiny space was packed with locals mostly ordering take out, but with lots of options to dine outdoors why take it back to the office?

The Original - Poached, organic chicken over fragrant chicken rice, garnished with cucumber and cilantro. Served with a fresh chili, ginger, garlic and soybean sauce and a side of chicken broth. I amped the flavors up to 11 by dousing the chicken in habanero sauce. Score!

Again, poached chicken isn't necessarily the girl next door, if you will. However, each ingredient is prepared carefully and executed well. For $11.95 I really can't complain about the portion size for the price. But I'll admit I could've used an XL portion!

It does get a little crazy inside, especially when folks don't listen for their numbers to be called, then it backs up the operation. For those looking for something extra, order a freshly cracked coconut for your pleasure! 

Rooster & Rice hits the nail on the head for a reliable, affordable and relatively healthy lunch.

excerpts: The Original: Breast and thigh with skin, poached organic Mary's chicken over fragrant jasmine chicken rice, garnished with cucumber and cilantro, Served with a fresh chili, ginger, garlic, soybean sauce, and a side of chicken broth ($11.95).
One of my favorite preparations of chicken is the Chinese style poached chicken, so I was excited to try this.
The chicken was tender and moist.
The sauce super flavorful.
The rice also had a nice savory note as I believe it was cooked in chicken stock.
The soup was clean and refreshing.
I've had this dish at a popular spot in Portland, so I was missing the chilis they gave us with that meal.
broth.author: Elena N.
broth.review:
For our weekly office lunch, I decided to get part one from Rooster & Rice. Our delivery order arrived on Friday, June 8th around 12:15pm via Caviar.

I got The Original: Breast and thigh with skin, poached organic Mary's chicken over fragrant jasmine chicken rice, garnished with cucumber and cilantro, Served with a fresh chili, ginger, garlic, soybean sauce, and a side of chicken broth ($11.95). One of my favorite preparations of chicken is the Chinese style poached chicken, so I was excited to try this. The chicken was tender and moist. The sauce super flavorful. The rice also had a nice savory note as I believe it was cooked in chicken stock. The soup was clean and refreshing. I've had this dish at a popular spot in Portland, so I was missing the chilis they gave us with that meal. Added a nice spice which I wish I had.

Great spot for Thai style chicken and rice. (Though a lot of people in my office thought this was too real. But they only really eat American Asian food.) I do adore a good khao man gai.

excerpts: Served with a fresh chili, ginger, garlic and soybean sauce and a side of chicken broth.
broth.author: Tu-Anh N.
broth.review:
TIME: TUESDAY @11:30am

SEATING: there's some communal seating indoors and some tables outdoors.

I'm so glad I planned for an early lunch (they open at 11am) because by the time it was noon, a line was formed.  I came at 11:30am and there was no line!

Since it was my first time, I thought I go for:

THE ORIGINAL - $11.95
Breast and Thigh with skin, jasmine white rice.
Poached, organic chicken over fragrant chicken rice, garnished with cucumber and cilantro. Served with a fresh chili, ginger, garlic and soybean sauce and a side of chicken broth.

They also have slices you can add:
- Thai Sriracha - sweet and mild. Goes so well with the chicken and rice!
- Habanero - didn't try it but I'm sure it's very spicy.

The chicken was tender and I loved the thigh (dark meat).  I love my food rich so I enjoyed all the skin that came with it!  The chicken rice was soft and everything I want in white rice--and there was a good amount of it!  As for the soybean sauce it comes with, although I don't like ginger, it's not terribly gingery. There's some peanuts in em!  This sauce is good if you want your food saltier, but I prefer the Thai Sriracha!

If you don't stuff yourself, you can turn this into 2 small meals--which is actually the portion we should be eating, hehe.  For the quality and amount you get in San Francisco, the price really isn't bad.  This place keeps it simple with simple food that tastes pretty darn good!

I'd like to come back and try the vegetarian! Oh and the staff is very friendly and attentive, even when it's just one person up front with a long line.

excerpts: My favorite part is the broth they give you on the side -
I'm not sure how they do it
but it is the cleanest yet most flavorful chicken broth I've ever had!
Really my favorite part!!!
They also sell a limited selection of drinks as well as whole baby coconuts if you want fresh coconut water
broth.author: Michele L.
broth.review:
Solid 4 stars. This place is on our take-out rotation, especially when we feel like being a bit more healthy.

The menu is simple: chicken + rice. You can choose between poached white meat or white/dark meat, and brown rice (+1 extra) or jasmine rice. The chicken is extremely tender and the rice is fragrant (they call it chicken rice). There is a side of sauce (ginger and garlic sauce = THE BOMB) and they have Habanero hot sauce and Thai Sriracha (I use a combo of both). My favorite part is the broth they give you on the side - I'm not sure how they do it but it is the cleanest yet most flavorful chicken broth I've ever had! Really my favorite part!!! They also sell a limited selection of drinks as well as whole baby coconuts if you want fresh coconut water :)

This location is open Mon - Fri and closes at 8pm. There is plenty of seating inside and outside and the line/wait is very short during dinnertime.

excerpts: For ~14 w/tax you can get yourself a whole breast and thigh, seasoned jasmine rice, cup of chicken broth, and their delicious chili, ginger, garlic and soybean sauce.
The chicken is moist and the sauce was killer.
You can definitely see all the ingredients they use in the sauce and it adds so much flavor to the chicken.
What I liked about R&R compared to C&R is that the rice is flavored a little more.
While C&R's rice tasted more like it was cooked in the chicken broth/fat, R&R tasted more garlicky - at least for me.
broth.author: Keizzel C.
broth.review:
Rooster & Rice is so simple but flavorful at the same time. Khao Mun Gai is a fave Thai dish of mine so after trying Chick'N Rice in the East Bay I knew I needed to try this SF staple. This location is great too because it's a a newly updated plaza with a fountain and plenty of seating for your meal. The location itself is quite small so come early to avoid the rush or you'll be part of the large mass waiting for their order to be called. 

For ~14 w/tax you can get yourself a whole breast and thigh, seasoned jasmine rice, cup of chicken broth, and their delicious chili, ginger, garlic and soybean sauce. The chicken is moist and the sauce was killer. You can definitely see all the ingredients they use in the sauce and it adds so much flavor to the chicken. What I liked about R&R compared to C&R is that the rice is flavored a little more. While C&R's rice tasted more like it was cooked in the chicken broth/fat, R&R tasted more garlicky - at least for me. 

I thought the meal was delicious and it was enough for two meals for me, however I think that the price is on the steep side for what it is.

excerpts: I ordered the original - seasoned jasmine rice with poached chicken and it comes with a side of broth.
I also ordered a poached egg for a few extra, but totally worth it!
It's not a fancy sit down, as every order comes in a take out container but who cares.
The food is excellent.
The chicken is juicy, the rice perfectly seasoned, and broth reminds me of home cooking/cozy feelings that warm your tummy.
broth.author: Jane K.
broth.review: I love it when simple things have been perfected. And that is exactly what rooster and rice is -- perfection. I ordered the original - seasoned jasmine rice with poached chicken and it comes with a side of broth. I also ordered a poached egg for a few extra, but totally worth it! It's not a fancy sit down, as every order comes in a take out container but who cares. The food is excellent. The chicken is juicy, the rice perfectly seasoned, and broth reminds me of home cooking/cozy feelings that warm your tummy.

excerpts: I wasn't a huge fan of the broth, as there wasn't a lot of flavor.
The fresh herbs were a great touch and the hot sauce was a fantastic pack of heat.
I'm so glad I added the egg!
It gave it a wonderful consistency and just the richness I was looking for in such a healthy meal.
Overall, the best tip I can give you if you're planning to visit for lunch is to order it to go.
You'll be glad you did.
broth.author: Jayme H.
broth.review:
I recently visited San Francisco for work and one day I found myself hungry with nowhere in particular to eat for lunch. A group of work buddies and I decided to explore the neighborhood around the office and we eventually found ourselves at Rice & Rooster. It was the twelve o'clock lunch rush so the place was extremely busy and there was a really long line. The way it works - You wait in line to place your order, place your order and pay at the register. From there you wait for your meal to be called out and then enjoy! For the size of the place and the huge amount of people visiting for lunch, it was pretty cramped. Thank goodness I didn't have to wait to long. My group and I were in and out in of there in roughly twenty minutes or so. We then meandered back to the office to eat, it was way to busy to sit down and enjoy it in house.

When it comes to the food, I ordered The Vegetarian and I added egg to it. The seasonal veggies were broccoli and cucumber, which was excellent. I only wish there was more of it! The tofu was soft and the rice was pretty basic. I wasn't a huge fan of the broth, as there wasn't a lot of flavor. The fresh herbs were a great touch and the hot sauce was a fantastic pack of heat. I'm so glad I added the egg! It gave it a wonderful consistency and just the richness I was looking for in such a healthy meal. Overall, the best tip I can give you if you're planning to visit for lunch is to order it to go. You'll be glad you did.

excerpts: I think the soup was chicken broth
broth.author: Tara A.
broth.review:
My coworkers and I decided to try out Rooster & Rice because we've heard that it compares to Nong's Khao Man Gai in Portland. After having Nong's, I guess my expectations were a little high because Rooster & Rice's chicken and rice was just okaaayy. I ordered the Paleo with all dark meat. The paleo comes with seasonal veggies instead of rice, and mine came with broccoli. I was glad to see they had sriracha and habanero sauce to fill up in the restaurant. 

Though I ordered dark meat, some of my chicken pieces were dry. However I did like the sauce, and I wished that I had added an egg after I saw my coworkers poached egg in her order! The sauce was really flavorful and had a small kick. I think the soup was chicken broth and it was pretty good.

It was a good lunch and i'd give it 3.5 stars, but at the end of the day, you're paying upwards of $12 to eat chicken and rice... Not worth it in my opinion since there are better things you can get for $12, but I would go again since it's rather healthy or if my coworkers wanted to go!

excerpts: If i could, I would hook myself up to an IV drip of their chicken broth soup.
broth.author: Jenni H.
broth.review:
As a lazy millennial who regularly takes the bus for 10 minute foot commutes, I would actually consider walking the 20 minutes to Rooster & Rice during my lunch break everyday. Do not underestimate the significance of this decision from the perspective of a highly sedentary individual.

Forget the fact I'm being charged an exorbitantly inflated price for what is just chicken and rice. Or that the meal is so incredibly sodium-generous that I hydrate enough afterwards to probably spike our water bill for the month. This place is the bomb. If i could, I would hook myself up to an IV drip of their chicken broth soup.

Unfortunately there's not a lot of easily accessible places in SF that make decent Khao Mun Gai, so as a slave to the laws of supply and demand, I find myself crawling back here more often than I'm willing to admit to order another bowl of the Original with a side of an egg.

excerpts: The chicken broth really hit the spot and completed the meal - it was hot, rich, and flavorful.
broth.author: Elvi T.
broth.review:
Okay price for hainan chicken, but everything was pretty spot on in terms of quality and quantity. 

I got the original which came with chicken, rice, and a bowl of soup. The chicken was juicy and tender, and went well with the soy sauce they provided. It in itself didn't taste like anything, but that's where the sauce comes into play I guess. The chicken broth really hit the spot and completed the meal - it was hot, rich, and flavorful.

excerpts: And you get a delicious bowl of chicken broth.
This is the kind of place you come to have lunch at if you wanted something (mostly) filling, yet healthy.
Price wise, it is your typical SF price point.
With a bowl ranging between $10-$13, plus extra for sides (egg, extra sauce, extra broth).
broth.author: Alex C.
broth.review:
If you haven't figured it out already, Rooster & Rice serves exactly what its name implies, chicken over rice. Much like In N' Out, you can stare at their menu being indecisive all day long. But ultimately, they really only serve varieties of one dish (chicken with or without skin, white or brown rice, or a vegetarian option with tofu instead of chicken). 

The chicken itself is plain, cooked with basically no seasoning and little to no additional oils. And you get a delicious bowl of chicken broth. This is the kind of place you come to have lunch at if you wanted something (mostly) filling, yet healthy. Price wise, it is your typical SF price point. With a bowl ranging between $10-$13, plus extra for sides (egg, extra sauce, extra broth).

I'm personally a fan of this location over the nearby Kearny location as this spot is a lot less crowded, friendlier, and the chicken actually tastes better (I find the Kearny location tends to overcook their chicken). Plus this spot offers outside seating next to a beautiful courtyard with a waterfall fountain.

excerpts: I swear the chicken broth is a warm hug in soup form...
super comforting.
I think I'll bring my own egg next time and save $2.
Overall, Rooster & Rice is solid.
I just had to dock a star for the price.
broth.author: Michele A.
broth.review:
Love me some Rooster & (no) Rice!! Keto-friendly but pricey AF. 

I ordered the Paleo all thighs over veggies $11.95, add an egg $2.00, plus chicken skin $5.00 (wanted to try, but probably won't get it again). Good grief! $20+ for simple but delicious chicken, veggies, and sauce. This is the kind of meal you order when you've just got paid and you're feelin like a baller.

The combo of chicken + chili sauce is where the magic happens. For keto-goers, I lightly dipped my chicken ever other bite because it was a bit sweet and I know ginger is hella carby. I focused my veggies on the habanero (low carb) sauce. I swear the chicken broth is a warm hug in soup form...super comforting. I think I'll bring my own egg next time and save $2. Overall, Rooster & Rice is solid. I just had to dock a star for the price.

excerpts: The broth was just okay, while the chicken, rice, and sauce were pretty spot on.
I could have done with more sauce than what was given
broth.author: Wayne H.
broth.review:
Very solid hainan chicken and rice. It's a not a great amount of food for the price, but about right for San Francisco lunch prices. You get chicken, rice, sauce, and a bowl of soup for the price, and you can also add egg, extra chicken, or extra sauce for a few dollars more. I went with the original with an egg, which was a decent portion and the egg was pretty well done.  The broth was just okay, while the chicken, rice, and sauce were pretty spot on. I could have done with more sauce than what was given but I guess I could pay for extra sauce next time. 

The natural comparison for Rooster & Rice would be to Nong's Khao Man Gai in Portland, which is still the superior hainanese chicken rice, but R&R is still a very solid option for a good lunch that I will be looking forward to coming back to again.

excerpts: I did appreciate the side of chicken broth (rich & delicious - would be perfect for a sick day), and the sauces that come with it (a vinegar and a spicy sauce).
broth.author: Nique F.
broth.review:
I guess I'm just not that thrilled by poached chicken & rice with some cucumbers on the side. I like my lunch to be a bit more colorful and complex. But hey - if you're into the clean eating, Paleo thing, Rooster & Rice is probably your jam. 

I did appreciate the side of chicken broth (rich & delicious - would be perfect for a sick day), and the sauces that come with it (a vinegar and a spicy sauce). Points for using Mary's Organic Chicken.

The line was pretty intense, took us about 20 minutes to get to the front and order. But, the outdoor seating is a lovely spot to chill with your chicken after. Super sunny and full of happy lunching people.

excerpts: The broth that came along with the chicken is where all the flavor went!
This was excellent (4/5), and I'd come back for the broth alone.
broth.author: Nicole H.
broth.review:
Gonna go against the tide here and say that the 5 star reviews are probably for the healthiness of this spot as a take out place, as opposed to the tastiness. To be fair, poached chicken is about one of the healthiest meals you can get around these parts without resorting to salad.

That being said, I found the chicken to be severely lacking in flavor (unlike really good Hainan chicken, which is super full of chicken flavor), though there was a good amount of it. At $14 though, it seemed like a fair amount. I would have preferred the sauce to be cooked into the chicken instead of a dip. 3/5.

The rice while the appropriate amount of oily, was a bit mushy. 3/5.

The broth that came along with the chicken is where all the flavor went! This was excellent (4/5), and I'd come back for the broth alone. 

Seating inside was nice. Seating outside by the fountain, while nice in theory, was a bit precarious given the (actual) swarm of mosquitoes that formed as I was eating....

excerpts: and it comes with just a super white lump of tofu, rice, some cucumbers, a side of brown sauce, a side of hot sauce, and a side of almost clear broth that we're apparently calling soup
broth.author: Candice G.
broth.review:
Not gonna lie, the presentation did not give me high hopes but Rooster & Rice legit made me eat my initial thoughts. 

They apparently only have one non-meat option (tofu) and it comes with just a super white lump of tofu, rice, some cucumbers, a side of brown sauce, a side of hot sauce, and a side of almost clear broth that we're apparently calling soup but I think that's kind of a stretch. 

My coworker got the chicken version and it looked exactly the same as mine only his super white lump was apparently chicken. 

We kind of looked at our containers for a minute and were like, 'oh boy' in the most sarcastic tone but then I drizzled some of the brown sauce, added probably too much hot sauce (the habanero one and the milder one were both great), and I chugged the 'soup' which was not very flavorful but even still, I like extra sh*t with my meal so it was exciting and on a colder day it's prob perfect. 

I tossed my box of stuff around with all the sauce and even though there was actually a whole lot of food in the portion, I couldn't stop eating until I finished the whole thing. It was healthy, delicious, and a real game-changer in terms of my lunch habits when I have to go into the office. No more oatmeal packets and microwavable soup cups for me!

excerpts: both sliced boneless with their skin left intact, accompanied by some jasmine white rice that got intimate with the cup of chicken broth that comes with the dish.
While we love broth-drenched rice, we didn't need the extra calories or barbs, and the chicken was nicely succulent
(photo: http://bit.ly/2eMp3Yg).
I barely used the spicy soy sauce preferring instead the chili-infused hot sauce they provide in squeeze bottles.
broth.author: Ed U.
broth.review:
Ever since Bryan Lew and Tommy Charoen opened up their Marina shop (review: http://bit.ly/2uXGQ5b), I was hoping they would open another shop closer to my neighborhood in SoMa. After all, I can never get enough steamed chicken, or in this case, poached Thai-style. There's only four items on the menu. The $11.95 Original is their most popular item and the classic version of Khao Mun Gai, a breast and a thigh, both sliced boneless with their skin left intact, accompanied by some jasmine white rice that got intimate with the cup of chicken broth that comes with the dish. The $12.95 Marina is aptly named because it's a skinless breast with brown rice.

That sounds so Marina. You can bypass the cluck entirely by ordering the $9.95 Vegetarian with tofu, brown rice and seasonal vegetables, or you can split the difference like what me and Jamie W. did and order the $12.95 Paleo which allows you the choice between a breast or a thigh and accompanied just by the seasonal vegetables with no rice. While we love broth-drenched rice, we didn't need the extra calories or barbs, and the chicken was nicely succulent (photo: http://bit.ly/2eMp3Yg). I barely used the spicy soy sauce preferring instead the chili-infused hot sauce they provide in squeeze bottles. It has a real kick which goes well with the broccoli.

By the way, broccoli is the only "seasonal vegetable" I've ever seen them serve so keep that in mind. There's more seating here than in the Marina, about a dozen seats inside, several patio tables on the immediate terrace and lots of open seating in the 303 2nd Street plaza, an inviting spot on a warm day akin to the wooden lounges on The High Line (photo: http://bit.ly/2eMabt0). I've been making a culturally insensitive remark by referring to the specialty here as Hainan chicken, the Singaporean dish which is what I am most familiar with from its best stateside version at the Savoy Kitchen down in Alhambra (review: http://bit.ly/2uWbMTL). But hell, this was pretty damn good, too.

FOOD - 4 stars...Thai-style poached chicken is a tasty delight for those looking for a Hainan chicken fix like me
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...small, clean and modern with a distinct lack of character and a primarily Asian target market...none of the Giants fans appear to stop here on the way to the game
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...OK, nothing special...though I like how they stay open until 8PM on weekdays for those of who don't work in the area...wish they'd stay open on the weekends
TOTAL - 4 stars...paleo is the way to go at this fast cluck stop

excerpts: It's all white meat chicken with veggies, brown rice, sauce, and a cup of broth.
Now granted this was a $15 lunch, it's not cheap.
broth.author: Tim G.
broth.review:
I took a break from my MealPal adventures and met up with a friend for lunch at Rooster & Rice. After reading the reviews, I decided we should probably head here before noon in order to beat the lunch time rush. We arrived at 11:45am and there was already a line forming out the door. 

The lunch line moves pretty quickly and they have already perfected the ordering process. I decided to go with The Marina because I'm still on a low calorie diet and this was nutritious enough for me to not have to worry about it turning into fat. It's all white meat chicken with veggies, brown rice, sauce, and a cup of broth. Now granted this was a $15 lunch, it's not cheap. I do feel like the ingredients are high quality and organic does give me the warm and fuzzies. 

Getting a table wasn't too difficult. Two seats freed up on the communal table by the time we got to the front of the line if you don't mind eating a strangers. Otherwise there's outdoor seating but it was a little too chilly outside for that. 

It would be great if they participate in MealPal though. I'd eat it daily.

excerpts: , it also came with chicken soup broth (this was my favorite!
Keeps my dry mouth wet) and I added an extra $2 for veggies (the only veggie was seriously....
broccoli
broth.author: Mindy Y.
broth.review:
Are you around the corner, or maybe you're looking for a quick lunch break, or maybe you just got off from working out at the gym... Looking for a quick bit? Rooster and Rice! You can smell it from a mile away! My mouth watered as I approached this delishyyy smellyyy place! HmMm!

Ordered the *ORIGINAL* - chicken breast and thighs topped on top of garlicky rice (it was kinda soggy, but no fear it was still good), it also came with chicken soup broth (this was my favorite! Keeps my dry mouth wet) and I added an extra $2 for veggies (the only veggie was seriously.... broccoli, so it wasn't really "like mixed vegetables" as I imaged it.)

Oh, the dipping sauce... DUNK your chicken on it and (omg) the rice! 

Approx. ~$14 = it was a good quick dinner... I ate everything up... it was a good dinner

**OVERALL: may possibly come back here... if I'm around the corner. tehe! 4 stars

excerpts: They also give you a side of clear chicken broth and a ginger/garlic sauce.
I highly recommend pouring some of the broth onto the rice and dipping the chicken in the sauce for extra flavor.
broth.author: Tiffany W.
broth.review:
If you're looking for something fast and simple, you'll love this place. There are only a few menu options, but it's yummy, if a bit overhyped. A little pricy for what you get, but pretty average for SF food. 

Got The Original chicken rice and it came with--surprise--some really tender chicken and jasmine rice, topped with cucumber and cilantro. They also give you a side of clear chicken broth and a ginger/garlic sauce. I highly recommend pouring some of the broth onto the rice and dipping the chicken in the sauce for extra flavor.

There's not much seating inside, but it's very clean and simple. Great option if you're looking for a quick, relatively healthy meal, but didn't entirely live up to the hype.

excerpts: You can also ask for additional chicken, rice, broth, sauces, etc. or even add an egg for a surcharge.
The prices range from $9.95 to $12.95.
There's several seats inside the restaurant if you're dining in but plenty of outdoor seating as well.
The chicken was succulent, the rice was pillowy soft and the broth was flavorful.
I finished every bite
and I'm already looking forward to my next visit when I'm back in SF.
broth.author: Annie P.
broth.review:
This was the best khao mun gai (poached chicken and rice) that I've ever had in the US (so far). My favorite Thai street food isn't offered at many restaurants back home, but even if it is -- it just never hit the spot... until I looked up "lunch" in my Yelp app while I was visiting SF and Rooster & Rice popped up.

The menu is simple and has 4 options: the original (breast and thigh with skin intact) over white rice, the skinless breast over brown rice, the vegetarian (tofu) over brown rice and seasonal veggies, and the paleo (breast or thigh) over seasonal veggies. You can also ask for additional chicken, rice, broth, sauces, etc. or even add an egg for a surcharge. The prices range from $9.95 to $12.95. There's several seats inside the restaurant if you're dining in but plenty of outdoor seating as well. They also offer delivery and pickup!

I went with the original and my expectations were exceeded. The chicken was succulent, the rice was pillowy soft and the broth was flavorful. I finished every bite and I'm already looking forward to my next visit when I'm back in SF.

excerpts: The chicken was tender and moist, brown rice seasoned extremely well (thinking that they might use the broth to make it), delicious sauce, and the broth was seasoned perfectly!
A healthy lunch option that's delicious, and it lasted me two meals.
Will def be here again, especially once the weather cools down.
broth.author: Andrea O.
broth.review: A teammate recently introduced me to Rooster & Rice, which was a dangerous move. I got the Marina (#2) and boy was it delicious! Takes me back to eating at street carts in Thailand! The chicken was tender and moist, brown rice seasoned extremely well (thinking that they might use the broth to make it), delicious sauce, and the broth was seasoned perfectly! A healthy lunch option that's delicious, and it lasted me two meals. Will def be here again, especially once the weather cools down.

excerpts: Tasted like it was cooked in or moistened with chicken broth to give it that extra flavor.
The runny egg added that final touch of color, texture, and flavor.
Bonus: came in a recyclable container.
Minus: tough to find parking in the area
but that's all of SF.
Overall, recommended and make sure to get extra sauce!
broth.author: Jay F.
broth.review: Had the Original (breast and thigh with skin on top of jasmine white rice and a side of sauce). Added a poached egg for $2 more. The chicken in of itself is nothing special and it tastes healthy cause of the way it's prepared (steamed?). Not dry at all, but the real star is the side of sauce which is tangy and sweet (almost tastes like a thinner Worcestershire with sugar and ginger). The rice too was a perfect accompaniment. Tasted like it was cooked in or moistened with chicken broth to give it that extra flavor. The runny egg added that final touch of color, texture, and flavor. Bonus: came in a recyclable container. Minus: tough to find parking in the area but that's all of SF. Overall, recommended and make sure to get extra sauce!

excerpts: I ordered their original ($12) which came with a good portion of chicken breast and thigh meat over seasoned rice, along with a bit of cucumbers, a dipping sauce, and a small chicken broth soup on the side, It's so simple yet very flavorful -- the seasoned rice goes so well with the light and dark meat of the chicken.
broth.author: Alvin W.
broth.review:
Fantastic chicken and rice dishes! Stopped by Rooster & Rice on a Friday evening with a group of friends -- it was surprisingly pretty empty and there were plenty of seats inside and outside.

I ordered their original ($12) which came with a good portion of chicken breast and thigh meat over seasoned rice, along with a bit of cucumbers, a dipping sauce, and a small chicken broth soup on the side, It's so simple yet very flavorful -- the seasoned rice goes so well with the light and dark meat of the chicken.

excerpts: The chicken broth is always my favorite part of the meal - it warms the soul!
broth.author: Wayne H.
broth.review:
Rooster & Rice is beloved by SF hipsters. Where else can you get boiled chicken over rice and pay over $15?!

Price aside, the food here is great! Simple preparation using quality ingredients makes for a very delicious meal. The chicken broth is always my favorite part of the meal - it warms the soul!

excerpts: For $11.95 (pre tax, SF mandate, etc.), you get a decent portion of chicken, rice and broth.
Normally, I don't like poached chicken because I think it is flavorless.
However, the sauce that they provide you makes the chicken taste GREAT!
The chicken itself is always moist and the consistency/quality is always there.
The rice isn't plain rice.
broth.author: Carolyn Z.
broth.review:
I've been here about 4 times now. I always order the original, and if available, I'll also order a bag of crispy chicken skins. For $11.95 (pre tax, SF mandate, etc.), you get a decent portion of chicken, rice and broth. Normally, I don't like poached chicken because I think it is flavorless. However, the sauce that they provide you makes the chicken taste GREAT! The chicken itself is always moist and the consistency/quality is always there. The rice isn't plain rice. It is quite flavorful, in a subtle way. 

During the lunch rush, there will be lines out the door because it takes them awhile to assemble the chicken bowls in the back. I suggest you come on the earlier end of lunch (think 11am) so that you don't encounter a line and can be in and out in no time. 

If you come with a group, and want to eat there, there are some tables outside as well as some seating inside. For large groups, I recommend you order take out or delivery.

excerpts: The rice is cooked in the chicken broth and the chicken is so juicy and tender.
The ginger sauce compliments the dish very well.
broth.author: Janie L.
broth.review: Hands down the best meal I had in SF. Looking at the picture you wouldn't think anything special; in fact, I had it bookmarked but we decided not go. Rooster & Rice happened to be next door to a place we were visiting, so we said why not. I am so glad we did. The dish looks so simple yet the flavors are so complex. The rice is cooked in the chicken broth and the chicken is so juicy and tender. The ginger sauce compliments the dish very well. Make sure to grab some of their homemade habanero hot sauce!

excerpts: The meal also comes with a yummy broth!
The quality of the chicken is amazing and everything tastes fresh.
What makes this meal outstanding is the soy sauce which is mixed with garlic and bunch of other good stuff.
broth.author: Mandi H.
broth.review:
Great staple lunch spot in SOMA. There's usually a line during the lunch rush but it moves relatively quick. There's some seating inside and outside as well. The menu is super simple which is not a bad thing but there is definitely room for growth. I have been here twice and both times I ordered "the original" with brown rice. It comes with chicken w/ skin (dark + white meat) over a bed of rice and a side of cucumbers. The meal also comes with a yummy broth! The quality of the chicken is amazing and everything tastes fresh. What makes this meal outstanding is the soy sauce which is mixed with garlic and bunch of other good stuff. SO flavorful and unique. 

I always forward to grabbing lunch here. Next time I definitely want to try the coconut drink that comes in an actual coconut!

excerpts: Not to mention, every bite of rice has the deliciously oily and flavorful chicken broth that it has been cooked in.
Oh, and for even MORE flavor, the dipping sauce will put you over the edge.
Nom nom.
The price is kind of steep given it is only chicken and rice, but they make a mean chicken and rice... and got no competition.
Just don't get the add-on "veggies" - For $2, all I got was some disappointing steamed broccoli.
broth.author: Vickie Z.
broth.review: Tastes great in-house and delivered. I am SO happy there is finally a place that specializes in Hainan chicken that you can count on. Who doesn't appreciate flavorful and tender chicken from the expected dry and flavorless? Not to mention, every bite of rice has the deliciously oily and flavorful chicken broth that it has been cooked in. Oh, and for even MORE flavor, the dipping sauce will put you over the edge. Nom nom. The price is kind of steep given it is only chicken and rice, but they make a mean chicken and rice... and got no competition. Just don't get the add-on "veggies" - For $2, all I got was some disappointing steamed broccoli. :(

excerpts: The most popular dish and the one I chose was "The Original" for $11.95: 2 pieces of poached organic chicken, thigh and breast with skin, sliced over a bed of jasmine rice cooked with chicken broth instead of water, topped with cilantro and served with cucumbers and a chili, ginger, garlic and soybean dipping sauce.
I added on a side of veggies (broccoli) for an extra $2.
OH EM GEE, I would come back time an time again for that ginger dipping sauce.
It was one of the best sauces I've had in a while.
broth.author: Rockne H.
broth.review:
I've heard about this place through coworkers for while, so when given the opportunity to grab some lunch here on a Friday afternoon, I quickly jumped on it! 

Don't get me wrong, I think paying about $12 for chicken and rice is a little extravagant but man, you have to try it. To back up a bit, when you arrive, you stand in a line that moves fairly quickly. The staff is super friendly and efficient. The menu, VERY simple so shouldn't take long to decide. There are 4 main dishes to choose from and 7 extras to add on. They also have fried chicken skins at the front for $5 with samples to entice you. 

The most popular dish and the one I chose was "The Original" for $11.95: 2 pieces of poached organic chicken, thigh and breast with skin, sliced over a bed of jasmine rice cooked with chicken broth instead of water, topped with cilantro and served with cucumbers and a chili, ginger, garlic and soybean dipping sauce. I added on a side of veggies (broccoli) for an extra $2. OH EM GEE, I would come back time an time again for that ginger dipping sauce. It was one of the best sauces I've had in a while. The chicken was good, the rice was heaven and add in that dipping sauce to elevate the entire dish from level 4 to 36, and you've got a HUGE flavor dish. 

I now know the reason for the hype. It's completely worth the price and overall, the food is exceptional. Just comes to show, simple ingredients made right and the people will come!

excerpts: My favorite part of the dish was probably the rice and the side of chicken broth they give you.
broth.author: Connie M.
broth.review:
I was a little skeptical to try this place out because I don't know how I feel about pale chicken.

I might be scolded by all the asians on here but I'm not used to eating blanched chicken so it was definitely a new experience for me.

I came here for lunch with coworkers and ordered the Original which has both chicken breast meat and thigh meat. The chicken was well cooked and tender. The dipping sauce was tasty and had some ginger flare. The spicy sauce on the side was spicy but gave the dish and interesting kick. My favorite part of the dish was probably the rice and the side of chicken broth they give you. They probably cook the rice in the chicken stock so it gave it a wonderful flavor and aroma. 

Overall, I think I prefer grilled chicken to boiled chicken. I feel like boiled chicken has a weird chewy texture and the skin creeps me out with the bumps. Also it almost makes the meat taste more gamey if that's even possible.

Fire away! I know I'll get heckled for this one because I don't have quite the seasoned palate for a dish like this.

excerpts: The broth on the other hand was a bit too salty for me
so I didn't finish that.
broth.author: Ang W.
broth.review:
I've been wanting to check this place out since I've returned from my vacation to Singapore. It looks and tastes just like Hainanese chicken but they call it Thai chicken. Anyways, the chicken was super tasty and moist. The sauce that comes with it compliments it so well. The rice was a bit too moist to my liking but still very flavorful. I tried it with their habanero hot sauce and it was amazing! Definitely satisfied my Hainanese chicken and rice craving!

The broth on the other hand was a bit too salty for me so I didn't finish that.

excerpts: As one whose diet often mirrors the latest Tim Ferriss podcast episode I can't live without the bone broth.
broth.author: Eric T.
broth.review:
There is no secret to why this place consistently has a long line out the door wrapping around the corner. It's delicious.

Silicon Valley techies from all over flock to enjoy the aromatic chicken remedy which soothes many a jaded startup soul. As one whose diet often mirrors the latest Tim Ferriss podcast episode I can't live without the bone broth.

It's tasty. It's healthy. It's succinct. It's delightful.

excerpts: The broth isn't my favorite.
broth.author: Lori W.
broth.review:
I love the simplicity of this food. It's super comforting and filling. I always get an egg, it's great mixed in with the rice. 

Negatives: the skin on the chicken is fatty. The broth isn't my favorite. 

I order ahead on caviar but you don't really need to since it's pretty quick.

excerpts: Every order typically comes with chicken, chicken rice, sauce, and a cup of chicken broth.
I really enjoyed the broth - it was light and pretty flavorful.
I also enjoyed the chicken rice, which was both well cooked and flavorful.
The actual chicken and sauce was a bit lackluster for me though, as I thought there would be more to it.
I ended up using the sriracha they have to add flavor to the chicken.
broth.author: Tim L.
broth.review:
If you're looking for something simple and healthy, this is probably the spot for you!  Every order typically comes with chicken, chicken rice, sauce, and a cup of chicken broth.  I really enjoyed the broth - it was light and pretty flavorful.  I also enjoyed the chicken rice, which was both well cooked and flavorful.  The actual chicken and sauce was a bit lackluster for me though, as I thought there would be more to it.  I ended up using the sriracha they have to add flavor to the chicken.  I think that this place could be improved by offering a wider variety of sauces for patrons to dip their chicken in - similar to comparable restaurants elsewhere.  

The price point is a little bit more than what I would like for a meal like this, but it was fair considering it was also downtown.  There's plenty of seating here, and everyone was super friendly.  If you want something light for lunch, I would definitely recommend stopping by Rooster and Rice!

excerpts: I ordered The Original which contains both breast and thigh meat over jasmine rice, cucumber, broth, and a dipping sauce.
The rice was perfectly cooked and flavored.
I wish they had the option of thigh meat only, but the breast meat wasn't too dry surprisingly!
The cucumbers were refreshing and the dipping sauce paired well with the chicken.
Wish the dipping sauce didn't contain peanuts though!
broth.author: Kristi T.
broth.review:
DELICIOUS! I am a huge fan of Hainan chicken rice and this is pretty delicious even though it isn't exactly the same dish! 

My friend and I dropped in around 1pm on a Wednesday and there was a still a line. The line goes by pretty quick, which is perfect for those with a short lunch break. I ordered The Original which contains both breast and thigh meat over jasmine rice, cucumber, broth, and a dipping sauce. The rice was perfectly cooked and flavored. I wish they had the option of thigh meat only, but the breast meat wasn't too dry surprisingly! The cucumbers were refreshing and the dipping sauce paired well with the chicken. Wish the dipping sauce didn't contain peanuts though! Also, the small cup of soup that came with it was great as well. 

For $13 (after tax) you get quite a lot of food. You could probably stretch this out over 2 meals! The interior is clean, though there isn't much seating. Thankfully, there are some seats available outside. Parking is difficult, which is typical of the area. Will definitely stop by for lunch whenever I'm in the area!

excerpts: I ordered the Original: chicken, rice, cucumber, soybean based sauce, and chicken broth.
Upon first bite, the chicken was tender, healthy tasting, but bland.
I was a little disappointed, but definitely not surprised.
But here's where I got undisappointed: when I tried the sauce!
The sauce is gingery, garlicy, and soybeany.
It complements the chicken and rice so well.
So if you enjoy the sauce, you'll definitely enjoy the chicken!
Similarly to Hainan chicken + rice, the chicken is poached so it's not very flavorful.
broth.author: Yi Xian R.
broth.review:
The food here is extremely aromatic especially when it's being cooked --- It's almost impossible to not want to try this place if you work in the plaza unless you have dietary restrictions or absolutely despise chicken. Every time I smell the chicken, I want to grab Rooster & Rice for lunch! The aroma definitely draws people in. 

However, I was hesitant to try this place because $13+ for what seems like the typical Hainan chicken with rice seems a little crazy to me because I can easily eat Hainan chicken at home for way less than that. But one day, I decided to treat myself to some Rooster & Rice! I wanted to know if the chicken tasted as good as it smelled and I wanted to know if Thai chicken + rice tasted like Hainan chicken + rice! 

AND GUESS WHAT, it did, sorta! 

I ordered the Original: chicken, rice, cucumber, soybean based sauce, and chicken broth. 
Upon first bite, the chicken was tender, healthy tasting, but bland. I was a little disappointed, but definitely not surprised. But here's where I got undisappointed: when I tried the sauce! The sauce is gingery, garlicy, and soybeany. It complements the chicken and rice so well. So if you enjoy the sauce, you'll definitely enjoy the chicken! Similarly to Hainan chicken + rice, the chicken is poached so it's not very flavorful. Sauces are essential to enjoying both chicken + rices! 

For around $15, the meal definitely filled me up just enough. I'll definitely come again when I feel like treating myself.

excerpts: I was very skeptical but the broccoli and the chicken do taste very very good in the broth.
broth.author: Rod M.
broth.review:
I like this franchise along with the location on Kearney . For those on a low carb or carb free diet the Paleo plate is a delicious option.

I was very skeptical but the broccoli and the chicken do taste very very good in the broth.

The price does seem a little high given what you get but that's sf for you. Both locations get very busy during lunch.

excerpts:
I would go here for the ginger soy sauce dip and the cooked rice - they probably cook the rice in chicken broth instead of water - because both were so good!

All orders come with a cup of chicken broth.
broth.author: Peter L.
broth.review:
I would go here for the ginger soy sauce dip and the cooked rice - they probably cook the rice in chicken broth instead of water - because both were so good!

Of the four options the Original was my favorite. It's a basic boiled chicken with warm rice comfort food. The Marina is "healthier" since it's skinless chicken with brown rice. The Paleo was good as well but it's just chicken and veggie. All orders come with a cup of chicken broth.

You can add a soft egg to each order but it's not needed unless you really want a runny egg with your meal. They have a dipping Sriracha sauce blend if you want a kick.

Go around 12:45pm or later and avoid the lunch crowd line. Be prepared to wait after ordering though.

excerpts: 1 small cup of chicken broth.
I'm not sure what to do with the chicken broth.
Do you just drink it?
Add it to the rice?
It is certainly the most confusing part.
broth.author: John W.
broth.review:
Chicken and Rice. It's a very simple meal. If that is what you are looking for, and you definitely aren't looking for any other variations, then this may be the place for you! If I am making it sound like a meal you might expect at a cafeteria, I haven't yet talked about the sauce! It's soy and ginger based, and it's all the seasoning you should expect. I am probably being unfair, because the chicken is cooked well, and the rice is also cooked. There's just not much more to expect. 

There is a line at lunch, so be prepared. At least they seem to have sorted out their service/capacity problem from the first time I visited. 

Let me run through everything in the $13 (after tax, no tip) original meal. Poached chicken on a bed of rice. 3 slices of cucumber, quartered. 2 oz of soy-ginger seasoning. 1 small cup of chicken broth. I'm not sure what to do with the chicken broth. Do you just drink it? Add it to the rice? It is certainly the most confusing part.

excerpts: It also includes fresh chili ginger garlic with soybeans sauce and a small cup size of fresh chicken broth.
As a result, that meal tasted flawless and outstanding!
It compared and tasted like eating a Chinese styled chicken breast right directly from an Asian supermarket because of a distinct broth taste!
Very clean and eatable to bite without any leftover bones around!
The brown rice also cooked perfectly without being too harden and dry especially the sliced cucumbers.
The sauce, da bomb goodness!
I really tasted the ginger into my mouth along with a spicier taste of chili and garlic combined!
Awesome sauce!
Finally, the chicken broth tasted superior and naturally delicious just like slurping Sawnson's Chicken Broth.
broth.author: William L.
broth.review:
On 8/1/2017, I decided to try this chicken food shop located within the 303 2nd Street building in South Market neighborhood called, "Rooster & Rice." Rooster & Rice serves the customers to taste their finest "Khao Mun Gai" entrees that will devour their tastebuds! The atmosphere and the concept is much simple by serving one of Thai's greatest and easiest food to go option by adding chicken and rice combined especially for vegans too which they also have organic tofu with rice as an alternative!

The employees from counters and cookers are doing a great job for making the customers like me a tremendous service! Friendly and approachable. No cons at all!

Now onto the food! I ordered "The Marina" chicken plate which it includes skinless, poached organic Mary's chicken breast with organic brown rice and slices of fresh cucumbers. It also includes fresh chili ginger garlic with soybeans sauce and a small cup size of fresh chicken broth. As a result, that meal tasted flawless and outstanding! It compared and tasted like eating a Chinese styled chicken breast right directly from an Asian supermarket because of a distinct broth taste! Very clean and eatable to bite without any leftover bones around! The brown rice also cooked perfectly without being too harden and dry especially the sliced cucumbers. The sauce, da bomb goodness! I really tasted the ginger into my mouth along with a spicier taste of chili and garlic combined! Awesome sauce! Finally, the chicken broth tasted superior and naturally delicious just like slurping Sawnson's Chicken Broth. Not a bad meal for lunch!

Parking at Rooster & Rice can be quite challenging to park. You can park at the nearby surface metered street parking if it's available. Alternatively, you can also ride a bike, walk, carpool, ride sharing or public transportation easier without the hassles and gimmicks.

In the end, Rooster & Rice is the finest and most remarkable chicken food shop that I've ever visited for the very first time right here in San Francisco! Perfect for your lunch or dinner break needs! A well visit! My rating: 4 solid stars.

excerpts: My favorite dish here is the "Paleo", which is Mixed Chicken with a bed of steaming fresh Vegetables and a cup of Chicken Broth.
Also, don't forget to get that amazing ginger dipping sauce on the side!
The sauce is seriously so addicting
and I don't blame you if you decide to drench all your chicken into it (guilty
broth.author: MyTien P.
broth.review:
I've been visiting Rooster & Rice frequently since they offer a nice selection of healthy food items and it's conveniently located down the street from my work! 

I'm a huge fan of Hainan Chicken and knew I had to give this place a try when they opened a location in the SoMa. My favorite dish here is the "Paleo", which is Mixed Chicken with a bed of steaming fresh Vegetables and a cup of Chicken Broth. Also, don't forget to get that amazing ginger dipping sauce on the side! The sauce is seriously so addicting and I don't blame you if you decide to drench all your chicken into it (guilty, that's what i did!).

The food here might be pricey but at least what they offer is healthier than the food trucks near by. Rooster & Rice has been added to my rotating lunch schedule for the week and I'm looking forward to visiting again later this week!

excerpts:
The meal comes with a small side of broth

Rooster & Rice is a bit overpriced, and service is very slow since this place is very popular these days
but my guess is it's cooked in some broth and seasoned.
overall, I really enjoyed this lunch -
I wish my food would come out faster
but I'd definitely come back for more :)
broth.author: Annie Z.
broth.review:
$15 for the rooster & rice entree + an egg. after tax. The meal comes with a small side of broth

Rooster & Rice is a bit overpriced, and service is very slow since this place is very popular these days but it was also delicious. This is definitely not traditional chinese chicken, but thai. I felt a bit mislead by the previous reviews, but i love all asian food so I wasn't disappointed. 

The white jasmine rice is not plain rice, I'm not sure how they season it but my guess is it's cooked in some broth and seasoned. overall, I really enjoyed this lunch - I wish my food would come out faster but I'd definitely come back for more :)

excerpts: The dish consists of brown rice, poached/skinless chicken breast, cucumbers , brown rice, and a side of bone broth.
broth.author: Kevin B.
broth.review:
Still solid. Probably one of the best/healthiest lunch options in SOMA.

Once again, I ordered the "Marina" sans egg on top. Damn, this meal certainly satisfies. The dish consists of brown rice, poached/skinless chicken breast, cucumbers , brown rice, and a side of bone broth. Make sure to snag a few sauces (everything from a soy sauce medley to a spicy red sauce) to douse on your poultry.

Word to the wise... Order in advance (online or by phone). If you just show up to the restaurant during lunch hours, prepare for a long wait. Also, prepare for a large portion. I usually have a pretty appetite, but I could only eat half of my "Marina." Fortunately, I enjoyed the rest of it at home for dinner.

This place is a winner!

excerpts: I love the little broth they give you.
broth.author: John M.
broth.review:
I was hit with a great smell upon entering this place.  The concept and food is pretty simple.  The Marina is my staple dish.  Good portion of tender chicken breast sliced up over brown rice.  I love the little broth they give you.

I don't think $13 bucks for lunch is crazy at all.  I hear from random people how this place is kind of expensive.  I don't get it.  If the food tastes fresh and healthy, then expect to weigh that into the price.

This place is kind of far for me but a worthy lunch spot for meal rotation.

excerpts: I did love the broth though
, it was light and refreshing tasting.
I like putting the chicken into the broth and eating it that way.
My Thai friend tells me the traditional way is cooking the rice in the chicken broth, but my brown rice was plain.
It's worth a try, but I wouldn't come back again.
This was also an EXPENSIVE lunch.
Broth is standard and good.
I tried my friend's regular white rice, and that was cooked in chicken broth and really, really good (unlike brown rice, which is just plain).
broth.author: Ke C.
broth.review:
Okay, it's more like a 3.5. It was too good to be a 3, but I needed to like it a little bit more to bump my rating to a 4. 

The chicken by itself tastes absolutely bland, and yes, it's all in the sauce, but I found the sauce similar to the sauce you dip XLBs or dumplings in, just with a whole lot of ginger... ALOT. 

I've had similar types of Chinese, Hainan Chicken, and generally those chicken have an inherent chicken-y umami flavor that doesn't rely so much on a soy based sauce. I did love the broth though, it was light and refreshing tasting. I like putting the chicken into the broth and eating it that way. 

Seasonal vegetables, if you get them, are guaranteed steamed broccoli (crunch is still retained!), and sliced cucumbers, nothing out of the ordinary. 

To me, this meal didn't strike me as Thai. My Thai friend tells me the traditional way is cooking the rice in the chicken broth, but my brown rice was plain. It's worth a try, but I wouldn't come back again. This was also an EXPENSIVE lunch. But you will be full!

UPDATE: I came back to try a second time. I got the paleo this time, with chicken thighs. GET THE THIGHS. It is alot more tender, and alot more tasty! I think the thighs make all the difference. So much protein, and a whole ton of broccoli. Broth is standard and good. I tried my friend's regular white rice, and that was cooked in chicken broth and really, really good (unlike brown rice, which is just plain).

excerpts: It also comes with chicken broth and ginger soy sauce.
The chicken here is moist, though it's not the typical Singaporean super fatty salty chicken type broth, with almost creamy rice.
broth.author: Kristie C.
broth.review:
You can't come here expecting Hawker Stall style chicken, but you can expect to a good fast, healthy and tasty meal. 

For ~$14, paleo chicken comes with a hefty portion of breast or thigh meat, some cucumbers (not pickled, sad) and steamed broccoli. It also comes with chicken broth and ginger soy sauce. 

The chicken here is moist, though it's not the typical Singaporean super fatty salty chicken type broth, with almost creamy rice. Nonetheless, I'm a huge fan and an even bigger fan of the outdoor seating. 

Tip: line seems to get massive around 1215!

excerpts: The chicken broth was richly flavored and steamy, the perfect heart-warming addition to any lunch in chilly SF days.
broth.author: Edna C.
broth.review:
Rooster & Rice's expansion into the FiDi was clever, especially in time for the Year of the Rooster. After all, which millennial wouldn't be able to resist an expensive but photogenic lunch with a clever fitting Instagram caption! (Yes I am aware that I am making fun of myself)

R&R illustrates my love-hate relationship with the SF food scene--it's delicious, wholesome, high-quality, global-inspired, but borders on downright unaffordable. My counter-service lunch of chicken over rice with sauce, cucumbers, and broccoli (an extra $2) totaled to $15.18! In Asia, you could probably serve the same dish to a small family at the same cost. 

Price rants aside, R&R creates an excellent rendition of Hainan chicken rice. My SF cynicism expected a gentrified version that would lose the original flavors and toss in random avocados and stuff (I do laugh at their poached egg option), but the complex flavors and superb quality exceeded my expectations. My favorite turned out to be the rice: the robust, fragrant chicken flavoring was memorable, and the unconventional amount of al dente-ness was a pleasant surprise. The sauce brought everything together in layers of sweet soy sauce blended with ginger, scallions, beans, and chili. I also opted for some habanero sauce (mainly to make my picture look more colorful), which added a mild creaminess.

Because of the distractingly good sauces, I found it difficult to evaluate the chicken itself. The chicken in this dish is always intentionally plain so you can fully appreciate the chicken essence. I think the use of Mary's chicken inherently has a different chicken-ness compared to the "yellow-haired chicken" (黃毛雞) traditionally used, so it's difficult to evaluate the poaching technique. The chicken broth was richly flavored and steamy, the perfect heart-warming addition to any lunch in chilly SF days.

Note that although it ins't your typical greasy food, the liberal use of chicken fat and various sauces make it a more filling lunch than you'd expect from a chicken meal. For me, it also left a bit of a salty aftertaste.

The space is hipster--upbeat almost-rap-like music, impressive arrangements of succulents, communal tables of course. Outside there's a beautiful public open space courtyard. 

The verdict? Yummy food, quite authentic, with a Californian flair, but at Marina prices.

excerpts: The rice, OH THE RICE, gave off a light, fragrant scent of jasmine combined with the mouth watering flavor of chicken broth.
The highlight and real test was THE SAUCE.
This is always the trickiest part to get right but the portions of the ingredients really hit the spot.
Sigh...
broth.author: Grace J.
broth.review:
YESSSS. Kao mun gai is my favorite Thai dish ever (and is very much a staple meal choice in Thailand) but sadly is not that well known or offered in Thai restaurants in the US. I'm so glad Rooster & Rice opened a second location close to where I work to share this amazingness with America! My cousin and I are both of Thai descent and went to this restaurant to see what the hype was about. Actually I was just really craving some kao mun gai and Rooster & Rice delivered! 

We got the original and were both very impressed. Portions were generous. Chicken was tender and flavorful. The rice, OH THE RICE, gave off a light, fragrant scent of jasmine combined with the mouth watering flavor of chicken broth. The highlight and real test was THE SAUCE. This is always the trickiest part to get right but the portions of the ingredients really hit the spot. Sigh... I love kao mun gai. 

We came the day after opening around lunch time so there was a delay in getting our orders out - I think they were waiting for the rice to cook. The owners acknowledged the delay and even offered to give us a free drink, but their generosity and that acknowledgement was all I needed. Thanks for being awesome and opening your doors to SOMA!

Pros
-Kao mun gai, duh!

Cons
-Kinda pricey, but it's soo goood

excerpts: Love the broth on the side, too.
I was in there for days at a time when I went to work sick
They provide a garlic soybean sauce with the order, but you can also add this orange hot sauce on the side.
The meal is super light
and I don't hate myself afterwards.
A weekly ritual!
broth.author: Genevieve M.
broth.review:
Tucked away in the corner of the plaza of 303 2nd Street, Rooster & Rice is a booming new craze in the South of Market area of San Francisco. During lunch hours the line is straight out the door, but this is expected as SoMa is chock-full of busy, urban professionals. Clean and modern feel on the inside. You order at the cashier and wait for your name to be called, and you can either grab a seat at a table/bartop or take it to-go.

Menu doesn't seem diverse, but each chicken-over-rice (or vegetables) combo has its own unique flair. I usually get the Marina -- breast, skinless over brown rice -- and it's amazing! Love the broth on the side, too. I was in there for days at a time when I went to work sick (-: They provide a garlic soybean sauce with the order, but you can also add this orange hot sauce on the side. The meal is super light and I don't hate myself afterwards. A weekly ritual!

excerpts: broccoli when I went), cucumbers, and a cup of chicken broth.
I got a mix of thigh & breast meat, and my it was so unbelievably tender.
The chicken flavorful and super juicy.
The price is a bit steep since it was $12.95 and after tax, about $14.
However, they use organic Mary's chicken and the chicken was indeed a enormous portion.
The broth was super flavorful and tasted like the kind of broth my mom would stew with chicken bones and make me drink when I was sick as a kid.
broth.author: Joy W.
broth.review:
As the name suggests, the specialities of this place are chicken & rice.

I got the Paleo Bowl which came with chicken, seasonal veggies (broccoli when I went), cucumbers, and a cup of chicken broth. I got a mix of thigh & breast meat, and my it was so unbelievably tender. The chicken flavorful and super juicy. The price is a bit steep since it was $12.95 and after tax, about $14. However, they use organic Mary's chicken and the chicken was indeed a enormous portion. The broth was super flavorful and tasted like the kind of broth my mom would stew with chicken bones and make me drink when I was sick as a kid. Definitely use the ginger garlic soybean dipping sauce that comes with it too!

The original bowl come with chicken & white jasmine rice, the Marina comes with brown, and there is also a vegetarian option that subs the chicken with organic tofu. You can also do add ons for a few dollars more, such as adding an egg. It's a great healthy lunch option or even post-workout meal. Over all it's a bit pricey for a meal, but the quality and portion sizes are worth it.

excerpts: I've had both the original and paleo which was both served with chicken broth and cucumbers.
(Can't go wrong with either chicken breast or chicken thigh) I personally love when dishes are served with a bit of freshly cut cucumbers, makes the meal taste clean and fresh.
Their side of ginger sauce is lightly sweet and perfect to pour over the whole dish or dip separately.
They also have a sriracha (standard) and a habanero sauce.
broth.author: Christine T.
broth.review:
This place is simply delicious! Great for lunch, they are super quick and nice service. Their poached chicken is perfectly cooked (I hate when you chew chicken and two seconds later it becomes saw dust in your mouth.) they give you about 6-8 oz. of chicken. I've had both the original and paleo which was both served with chicken broth and cucumbers. (Can't go wrong with either chicken breast or chicken thigh) I personally love when dishes are served with a bit of freshly cut cucumbers, makes the meal taste clean and fresh. Their side of ginger sauce is lightly sweet and perfect to pour over the whole dish or dip separately. They also have a sriracha (standard) and a habanero sauce. The habanero sauce is definitely spicey but not overbearing which gives the dish a really nice kick to it. 

The place is small, but there is a ton of seating outside and on a nice day, it's generally preferred. For $13, I'd say it's worth it. I always feel full, but not the gross kind of full that makes you feel sluggish and want a nap after. This place is definitely my go to lunch spot.

excerpts: There's not much else to say here other than that they've done a great job capturing both the flavor and simplicity of this comfort food, serving up tender and moist chicken, with an equally flavorful side of chicken broth to pair.
Of course, expect the typical SF tax on what is traditionally a pretty cheap eat, but hey, that comes with the territory,
broth.author: Johnny W.
broth.review:
*** In Short ***

Tasty and accessible Thai chicken rice in an area all-too-lacking in Asian food.

*** In Depth ***

If you've never had khao man gai, it's the Thai take on Hainan chicken rice: similar in preparation, but with a slightly different flavor profile. Simple, but somewhat time-consuming to make, Rooster & Rice finally brought what it had to offer to SoMa, after a successful start in the Marina. And thank god they did, because this part of town has always been a bit lacking in solid Asian eats!

There's not much else to say here other than that they've done a great job capturing both the flavor and simplicity of this comfort food, serving up tender and moist chicken, with an equally flavorful side of chicken broth to pair. Of course, expect the typical SF tax on what is traditionally a pretty cheap eat, but hey, that comes with the territory, right?

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - A smaller shop with plenty of seating in the courtyard outside, the only real accessibility issue you might face here is reaching their hot sauces, which are usually on a pretty high shelf above another counter. That, and carrying about your soup without spilling it.

Bathroom - Didn't try them.

excerpts: Chicken broth comes with the entree and it's delicious.
Piping hot, not crazy salty and actually tastes like, well, chicken.
broth.author: Fannie S.
broth.review:
Food = good. Fresh and clean tasting.

The Original = breast & thigh skin-on with Jasmine white rice. Tender and juicy breast and thigh--they're both so good. Habanero sauce in addition to their awesome (chili, ginger, garlic & soybean) sauce makes this chicken & rice dish even more epic. Chicken broth comes with the entree and it's delicious. Piping hot, not crazy salty and actually tastes like, well, chicken. $11.95. 

I added an egg. Because why not. $2.00. 

They also have fried chicken skins ($5.00) but they were out after 1 p.m. Maybe next time... 

Service = friendly at the counter. Everything else is self-service. And almost everything is compostable/biodegradable.

Prices = moderate. Lunch came out to $15.14. Probably would've had leftovers if I hadn't waited so long to have lunch. There's plenty to eat though.

excerpts: Their Original is a combination of chicken thigh and breast all boneless on a wonderful bed of fragrant rice with a side of chicken broth.
The Asian me screams thigh meat is the way to go for all chicken dishes since chicken breasts are often super dry and tasteless.
However, their chicken breast meat super tender, flavorful, and juicy.
If you want to wash down your chicken rice with some liquid, you can drink their super flavorful chicken broth.
You will be in full chicken heaven!!
broth.author: Hoyan L.
broth.review:
I'm a HUGEEE fan of chicken and rice dishes, particularly Hainan chicken rice. When I saw this place popped up, I knew I had to pay it a visit! After a long day at work, I was really craving something simple and delicious and Rooster & Rice was just around the corner. 

I have never had Khao Mun Gai, which is a Thai version of Hainanese chicken rice, but I have had Hainanese chicken rice countless times in the past. I ordered their Original (around $12 with tax). Their Original is a combination of chicken thigh and breast all boneless on a wonderful bed of fragrant rice with a side of chicken broth. The Asian me screams thigh meat is the way to go for all chicken dishes since chicken breasts are often super dry and tasteless. However, their chicken breast meat super tender, flavorful, and juicy. When I took a bite of their chicken with a scoop of the rice with a little bit of their habanero hot sauce, I was in full chicken heaven bliss. Not only is their chicken good, but the rice is packed with chicken oils and flavor. I have not tasted a chicken rice this flavorful in a very long time. Many Chinese places serve Hainanese chicken rice, but most of them fail to deliver juicy chicken and flavorful rice. This place has PERFECTED their chicken and their rice. 

Once I took the first bite of this mega flavorful chicken and rice, I couldn't stop myself from finishing the entire box. Put some of their housemade sweet, sour, garlicky, gingery sauce and the housemade habanero sauce onto the chicken rice to give it the most perfect spice and flavorful kick. If you find yourself in need of some veggies, you can crunch on little pieces of cucumber that are given as a side. If you want to wash down your chicken rice with some liquid, you can drink their super flavorful chicken broth. You will be in full chicken heaven!!

excerpts: The broth on the side is a nice touch and i love that the veggies are fresh and still have a bit of a crunch to them.
The chicken is poached to perfection: flavorful and tender.
broth.author: Danielle D.
broth.review: I love how simple, clean and fresh the ingredients are at Rooster & Rice. The broth on the side is a nice touch and i love that the veggies are fresh and still have a bit of a crunch to them. The chicken is poached to perfection: flavorful and tender.

excerpts: The broth, to be honest, is probably the best part of the meal.
Amazing!
Although, this place is a bit expensive and the wait times can get a bit crazy depending on the time of day.
broth.author: Leelakrishna N.
broth.review:
I love rooster and rice. The food is so cozy, simple and filling. The chicken is always well cooked and tasty and goes well with the rice and the sauce. The portions are sizeable as well. The broth, to be honest, is probably the best part of the meal. Amazing!
Although, this place is a bit expensive and the wait times can get a bit crazy depending on the time of day.

excerpts: My chicken broth was light and delicious.
broth.author: Jane H.
broth.review:
This place has a very simple menu, which I like. Chicken and rice, that's it (save for a vegetarian option).

My companion and I ordered the original rooster bowl and a vegetarian bowl. They come with little cups of soup on the side! My chicken broth was light and delicious.

At first glance, the chicken looks cold and flavorless, but looks can be deceiving. The meat was very tender, but the sauce was the real star, mixed with a little of the habanero sauce for a spicy kick. Very good. The only thing I didn't really like was the skin that they left on the meat- I'm not a big fan of chewy skin but to teach their own.

 The veggie bowl was fine, but the chicken was better imo. Also we ordered an extra egg, which turned out to be poached, not fried. The eggs were kind of inconsistent in that one still had a runny yolk, while the other was completely solidified. A little weird, but it didn't really bother me.

The seating is very minimal. Server was very nice and polite, but it took a while to get our order. Overall, probably a 4.5.
