excerpts: I've never been told that the Jasemine rice was cooked with chicken broth.
Severely disappointed in this company for not better informing their customers.
broth.author: Kyoko L.
broth.review: The Jasemine rice is NOT VEGETARIAN. Food is good, but from the dozens of times I've been here I've never been told that the Jasemine rice was cooked with chicken broth. Severely disappointed in this company for not better informing their customers.

excerpts: I love your portions, your rice, your chicken, your sous-vide egg, and your broth.
broth.author: Jayson V.
broth.review:
I love your portions, your rice, your chicken, your sous-vide egg, and your broth. It's as close to Savoy Kitchen or Green Zone from SoCal that I can get in the Bay Area. 

Also your paper napkins are luxurious! Holy crap, one of our to-go broths leaked in my fridge because of my fault (I didn't snap on the lid fully after opening it) and the next day I opened the fridge, the napkins absorbed all of the soup. Can't be good for the environment but appreciate having such quality napkins.

But food is better than napkins so gonna end it on that note.

excerpts: Broth also good.
Great customer service.
broth.author: Kelley P.
broth.review:
Simple and straight forward. Wanted more cucumbers/veggies with my order, but will keep that in mind for next time (guess I'll have to ask for extra?). I got The Marina which comes with skinless chicken breast & brown rice. Sauce was good, went well with the chicken & rice which were also very good. Broth also good. Great customer service. Quick and easy pick up after my workout nearby.

Other:
They don't have Apple Pay, despite what the info says.

excerpts: They always give you a side broth as well (usually very hot, so I would let it cool down a bit first).
This spot is more of a to-go spot, but there are a few tables.
Their spicy sauce is super good, but warning-a little goes a long way, so don't be dumping it on!
It is your typical SF price point, but definitely a filling meal!
I definitely recommend!
broth.author: Kim C.
broth.review: Love everything about Rooster & Rice. This is my boyfriend and my go-to spot for a weekday quick dinner. Luckily, they are open until 8 PM Monday-Fridays (unlike a lot of other restaurants in the area that are generally only open for the lunch crowd). Rooster & Rice uses Mary's Chicken (you can get breast or thighs) over jasmine rice (or you can get brown rice). They always give you a side broth as well (usually very hot, so I would let it cool down a bit first). This spot is more of a to-go spot, but there are a few tables. Their spicy sauce is super good, but warning-a little goes a long way, so don't be dumping it on! It is your typical SF price point, but definitely a filling meal! I definitely recommend!

excerpts: The chicken broth side was a teeny tiny too salty, but still delish.
This location has plenty of indoor and outdoor seating, but it's still best to come on the early side of the lunch hour.
broth.author: Tabitha G.
broth.review: Deceivingly simple but really tasty chicken and rice bowls.  I was a bit skeptical at first, but demolished my lunch in record time today.  The chicken was tender, the jasmine rice was aromatic - but the whole dish comes together owing to the tasty soy ginger sauce, which is a riff off of classic Asian/Chinese flavor profile (chicken + ginger).  The chicken broth side was a teeny tiny too salty, but still delish.  This location has plenty of indoor and outdoor seating, but it's still best to come on the early side of the lunch hour.

excerpts: Besides the vegetarian option, each dish comes with a side of chicken broth.
The place is pretty small and gets crowded during lunch
broth.author: Vijay S.
broth.review:
Rooster and Rice serves hainan style chicken and rice. It's a really simple poached chicken dish with some fragrant rice and sauce (soy, ginger and garlic). Besides the vegetarian option, each dish comes with a side of chicken broth. The place is pretty small and gets crowded during lunch so it's better to order it to go. 

It's simple but man do they do it well, it's one of those comfort foods that you can have every day and not really get bored of it. 

My go to order is The Original ($12) plus a poached egg ($2). The runny egg over rice just makes it that much better. They have a house habanero sauce that packs a nice kick that I add as well.

I know people complain about the price being high, but being in SF and comparing it to a $15 salad, it really isn't that bad. My only complaint is that it's not closer to where I work. 

Tip:
Some days they fry up the chicken skins and have it available for $5, if you're with a group it is worth sharing

excerpts: It might be on the bland side for people who are unsure of what to expect, but to me, the light flavors of the broth and chicken are a perfect combination along with the sweet/savory cilantro/ginger/garlic sauce that it all comes with.
It's a healthy and fast meal that is great on a cold day!
broth.author: Annie S.
broth.review: Such a solid spot for lunch! Chicken and rice prepared the hainan style is definitely comfort food for me and this spot delivers! It might be on the bland side for people who are unsure of what to expect, but to me, the light flavors of the broth and chicken are a perfect combination along with the sweet/savory cilantro/ginger/garlic sauce that it all comes with. It's a healthy and fast meal that is great on a cold day!

excerpts: The dish came with soy sauce mix on the side and a bowl of chicken broth.
I was nervous to pour the entire cup of soy sauce but it worked out perfectly.
To my surprise, the dish wasn't too salty even with all the soy sauce.
I'm glad I chose to get all dark meat because the meat came out juicy and flavorful (not dry at all).
The addition of the egg gave the rice a creamy texture -not creamy in a weird way.
The cucumber and cilantro gave the dish a refreshing kick.
If I were to get this dish next time, I would opt to get it without the skin.
I wasn't a fan of the mushy skin (for some reason I thought the skin would be crunchy lmao).
The chicken broth went soo well with the rice.
Such an Asian combo :) aka the rice x broth.
I never knew this was a Thai dish
and I'm glad a place like this exists!
Overall, Rooster and Rice was very memorable!
broth.author: Victoria L.
broth.review:
Yum!  As the restaurant's name suggests, this place literally has only rice and chicken haha.  The location is tucked away in the plaza so it was nice and quiet when we came in around 3p. 

I ordered the original with dark meat only and added an egg.  The dish came with soy sauce mix on the side and a bowl of chicken broth. I was nervous to pour the entire cup of soy sauce but it worked out perfectly. To my surprise, the dish wasn't too salty even with all the soy sauce.  I'm glad I chose to get all dark meat because the meat came out juicy and flavorful (not dry at all).  The addition of the egg gave the rice a creamy texture -not creamy in a weird way.  The cucumber and cilantro gave the dish a refreshing kick. If I were to get this dish next time, I would opt to get it without the skin. I wasn't a fan of the mushy skin (for some reason I thought the skin would be crunchy lmao).  The chicken broth went soo well with the rice. Such an Asian combo :) aka the rice x broth. I never knew this was a Thai dish and I'm glad a place like this exists!  Overall, Rooster and Rice was very memorable!  10/10 recommend. 

Oh, grab a Thai tea while you're at it!

excerpts: The chicken broth that comes with the meal was amazing.
broth.author: Victor L.
broth.review:
Nestled in a shopping plaza located in SOMA, lies Rooster and Rice.  The place gets crowded during lunch, but with a simplistic menu that only offers a few things, the line should move quickly.  There are plenty of seats inside, but if every spot is taken, there are still lots of places to sit outside.  

Rooster & Rice does live up to the hype, but it comes with a price tag.  My rice box ended up costing me a whopping $16.22.  I ordered ​"The Marina" which comes with all skinless breast, and organic brown rice.  I also added an egg to my order.  

I waited several minutes for my order, and decided to load up on sauce at the condiment and utensils area.  You are also able to purchase sauce at the counter, but why would you if it is free here?  They also have really good quality napkins here too!  I guess you could say that is why a rice box costs so much here?  

After grabbing a seat, I decided to try the chicken without any sauce first.  I took a bite, and the meat was ultra soft-- melt in your mouth type quality.  However, there was no seasoning whatsoever.  It tasted so boring and plain.  I decided to try the next bite with the spicy sauce and the ginger garlic sauce. The flavors were a fusion of multiple parties in my mouth.  Needless to say, it was delicious.  The brown rice was cooked well.  The egg was a little under for my liking.  The chicken broth that comes with the meal was amazing.  I thoroughly enjoyed how flavorful it was.  

In conclusion, this place is good.  However, this is something I would not get every day.  For $16, I could get three rice boxes in Chinatown.  I would consider trying this place at least once though  because it is very unique.

excerpts: But that lunch will be filled with juicy, healthy chicken on a bed of delicious rice served with a little cup of bone broth.
Healthy, filling and oh so satisfying.
What gets ya is the additional add-on's, pricewise.
Want extra veggies?
Want an egg?
broth.author: Stephanie Y.
broth.review:
The lines will be long, but it goes by fast and it's worth it, yo!

You will be spending about $15+ on lunch though, no doubt. But that lunch will be filled with juicy, healthy chicken on a bed of delicious rice served with a little cup of bone broth. Healthy, filling and oh so satisfying. What gets ya is the additional add-on's, pricewise. Want extra veggies? $3. Want an egg? $3. Goodbye are the days of cheap eats for lunch.

Order the original with white rice, the marina with brown rice, the paleo with seasonal veggies in lieu of rice or the vegetarian, tofu in lieu of that chicken.

They have a tasty soy based sauce to pour on and don't forget your little cups of sriracha or what looks to be housemade habanero. If you're gonna drop $15+ on lunch, this is a great option.

Plenty of outside seating both with tables and chairs, but also some funky seating in the courtyard; perfect for a sunny San Francisco day.

excerpts: It also comes with chicken broth on the side, which is lightly flavored and comforting.
broth.author: Brittany C.
broth.review:
As everyone seems to agree, this place is a solid four stars. Great place to get a filling and (relatively) healthy meal in downtown. Rooster & Rice serves a Thai variation of Hainanese chicken rice, which features juicy, tender chicken over rice, combined with a very flavorful soy-based sauce. The portion size is generous and will leave you feeling satisfied. It also comes with chicken broth on the side, which is lightly flavored and comforting.

The menu is short, featuring only a few variants of chicken rice with clever names like "The Marina" -- a healthier skinless chicken option over brown rice. As a result, the line moves quickly, so don't be intimidated by what looks like a long wait.

Docking a star because it's so pricy, but I'll probably still make my way over every now and then, because the chicken rice really is that good.

excerpts: The menu is simple- just chicken & rice or chicken & veggies with a side of chicken broth.
Who knew chicken and rice can taste so good and be satisfying?
It must be that ginger soy based sauce!
They also offer a side of the habanero and siracha sauce as well to complement your meal.
Seating is limited and there is usually a line out the door during lunch but it goes fairly quick.
A great "Asian" alternative to the area.
broth.author: Melanie N.
broth.review: New lunch spot in SOMA and I'm a fan!  It's located in the same plaza as Red Dog.  The menu is simple- just chicken & rice or chicken & veggies with a side of chicken broth.  Who knew chicken and rice can taste so good and be satisfying?  It must be that ginger soy based sauce!  They also offer a side of the habanero and siracha sauce as well to complement your meal.  Seating is limited and there is usually a line out the door during lunch but it goes fairly quick.  A great "Asian" alternative to the area.

excerpts: The Original comes with a bed of fragrant jasmine chicken rice, pieces of cucumber, some broth, and a soy based sauce with soybeans, ginger, garlic, and chili.
They provide a good amount of meat which consists of both white breast meat and dark thigh meat.
The meat is boneless, but has skin on it.
The chicken turned out to be some of the most juicy chicken meat I've ever had.
There was not a single piece of dry chicken to be found and each bite was a succulent artistic work that artists like Van Gogh and Ringo Starr could only dream of.
It's just so wonderful to have such delicious boneless chicken meat since it isn't messy to eat and is also easy to eat which is great for a quick workday lunch.
The rice is filled with the savory umami flavor from the chicken to make it the idea carb to complement the meat.
The cucumber adds a contrast to all the umami flavor by adding a bit of sweetness to the meal\.
The refreshing nature of it pairs very well with the chicken especially when the chicken is dipped in their habanero or thai sriracha sauce for a spicy kick.
Their soy based sauce adds so many wonderful flavors with the chicken.
The fragrance of the ginger with the saltiness of the soy sauce help to accentuate the natural flavors of the chicken rather than detract from it.

If all this wasn't good enough, the chicken broth on the side provides an aspect of warmth to the meal, reminding me of homemade chicken soup that could heat up a home on a cold winter day and help heal the sick.
broth.author: Joshua M.
broth.review:
IT'S SOOOOOOOOO GOOOOOD!!!

But seriously though, I just finished it a few minutes ago and now I have very conflicting feelings. I'm super happy because I just had an amazing lunch. I'm also super sad because I'm done and there's no more. Are these tears tears of joy or tears of sadness, or am I just crying because my sneaky ninja coworkers are cutting onions again? Is this how Anton Ego felt when he took his first bite of that ratatouille? Well, in Whoville they say that the Grinch's small heart grew three sizes that day.

Rooster & Rice, located as part of the nice plaza at 303 2nd Street, is a small little restaurant that specializes in Khao Mun Gai which is also known as Hainanese Chicken. If you love Hainanese chicken, you'll for sure love the chicken here. If you're not sure if you love Hainanese chicken, then this might just be the place you fall in love with it.

I've passed by this place a couple times with an intention of trying it out, but I typically find a long line here around noon so I end up opting for something else. However, on this Friday afternoon, I noticed there wasn't a line so I rushed in and quickly ordered The Original to go. I was a bit skeptical of the chicken here once I found out it was boneless, since I love dark meat and find the meat around the bone to be the most juicy and flavorful. Also, when my meal came out to be $13 flat after tax without adding any extras such as veggies or egg, I thought to myself, "This better be good."

The Original comes with a bed of fragrant jasmine chicken rice, pieces of cucumber, some broth, and a soy based sauce with soybeans, ginger, garlic, and chili. They provide a good amount of meat which consists of both white breast meat and dark thigh meat. The meat is boneless, but has skin on it. The chicken turned out to be some of the most juicy chicken meat I've ever had. There was not a single piece of dry chicken to be found and each bite was a succulent artistic work that artists like Van Gogh and Ringo Starr could only dream of. It's just so wonderful to have such delicious boneless chicken meat since it isn't messy to eat and is also easy to eat which is great for a quick workday lunch. The rice is filled with the savory umami flavor from the chicken to make it the idea carb to complement the meat. The cucumber adds a contrast to all the umami flavor by adding a bit of sweetness to the meal\. The refreshing nature of it pairs very well with the chicken especially when the chicken is dipped in their habanero or thai sriracha sauce for a spicy kick. Their soy based sauce adds so many wonderful flavors with the chicken. The fragrance of the ginger with the saltiness of the soy sauce help to accentuate the natural flavors of the chicken rather than detract from it. If all this wasn't good enough, the chicken broth on the side provides an aspect of warmth to the meal, reminding me of homemade chicken soup that could heat up a home on a cold winter day and help heal the sick.

Needless to say, I'm a huge fan of Rooster & Chicken and if you're in the area looking for lunch, this restaurant is surely a solid choice!

excerpts: The broth was good too.
broth.author: Sara L.
broth.review:
Thought that the khao mun gai here was a homey, comforting, and satisfying meal. 

I ordered The Original for myself. The chicken in the bowl was lean yet very tender and flavorful. My boyfriend ordered The Marina because he doesn't like when chicken is fatty or has skin, but I actually think that he would've been just as happy with The Original. The chicken in The Original (even the thigh) was just as lean, and I actually didn't get any skin in my bowl. That last part might be a big negative to some, but I didn't mind much. The broth was good too. Full of flavor, and not heavy or oily.

The jasmine rice was like the rice that's usually included in Hainan chicken dishes, in that it was very flavorful on its own. For that reason, don't dump the whole sauce container over the rice! The sauce is SUPER delicious, but if you put too much into the bowl, it can overpower the flavors of the chicken and the rice. Same goes for the optional Thai sriracha and the habanero sauce that they offer. SO good, but be careful how much you use because the bowl is far from bland even without them. 

Would this be 5 stars if this was cheaper? Definitely. In fact, I have no doubt that the same dish could be as little as half the price in Thai restaurants located elsewhere, like LA or Thailand itself. But let's be real: This is San Francisco. This is where many people don't think twice about dropping $15 for a simple salad. So Rooster & Rice isn't cheap, but I wouldn't say it's overpriced.

With that said, I really enjoyed the food here, and I'm happy that they opened this SoMa location.

excerpts: The portion sizes are solid, but you're still paying $12+ for chicken and rice and a little cup of broth.
broth.author: Alex L.
broth.review:
I'm told the food here is authentic, which I guess means a lot more to other folks. The chicken and rice dish (pretty much the only thing on the menu) is tasty enough, if a little bland on its own; you've got to pour on the included garlic/peanut sauce (or Sriracha) to get strong flavors. Once you do, it's pretty good. 

The portion sizes are solid, but you're still paying $12+ for chicken and rice and a little cup of broth. It doesn't quite feel like a great lunch value and I certainly don't enjoy waiting 20+ minutes in line to place my order and get the food. 

Beware the upsell! The first time I went there I blindly said "Yes" to every question they asked, and I walked away with a lunch that cost nearly $20. Serves me right for being such an agreeable person, I guess.

excerpts: The broth soup it comes with is 10/10.
It warms me from the inside out.
I'm willing to pay the money for this place, which must mean it's GOOD.
Will come again!
broth.author: Serena W.
broth.review: New favorite chicken comfort food place. Been here twice and I am a huge fan of the place already!! The sauce is delicious (I am a big ginger fan but even if you're not, you'll still like its sweetness). The chicken is nice and tender. You can sub brown rice for white at no extra charge. I have only gotten the original, but for me that's all I need! Friend got the paleo and it felt like there was a lot more chicken, but I could be wrong, as I easily finished mine while she took a while to eat. The broth soup it comes with is 10/10. It warms me from the inside out. I'm willing to pay the money for this place, which must mean it's GOOD. Will come again!

excerpts: I love their broth as there is no MSG in it.
I wish there were more veggies with the meal.
Thank is why I am giving a 4 star.
broth.author: Stephanie C.
broth.review: My girlfriend told me about this location.  This is my second time and now I know how to order.  I had the Original and the Marina.  Marina has brown rice and no skin on the chicken .  The original has white rice and skin on some pieces of the chicken.  I always call in so I can stand in line versus ordering there.  I love their broth as there is no MSG in it.  I wish there were more veggies with the meal.  Thank is why I am giving a 4 star.

excerpts:
The secret is the super flavorful rice, flavored with chicken broth, chicken fat, oil, and whatever sauce you include, such as garlic. 

All orders also come with a ginger/garlic/spicy/sweet/soy sauce and a side of chicken broth, which you can drizzle on the chicken and rice to add more flavor.
broth.author: Kate M.
broth.review:
Finally, a decent place to get khao mun gai in SF! Kao mun gai, or the Thai verson ofHainan chicken rice, is one of the most popular street food in Singapore, and despite its extremely simple premise, is super flavorful. The secret is the super flavorful rice, flavored with chicken broth, chicken fat, oil, and whatever sauce you include, such as garlic. 

Rooster & Rice gives khao mun gai an SF flair, with an option to make it "Marina healthy" with skinless chicken breast and brown rice, or Paleo, chicken & veggie. I like the healthy customization, but if you want the true khao mun gai experience, you should try the Original option, with the poached/boiled chicken and the oh-so-delicious chicken fat rice. All orders also come with a ginger/garlic/spicy/sweet/soy sauce and a side of chicken broth, which you can drizzle on the chicken and rice to add more flavor. 

It's a tad expensive, especially for what is essentially street food in Asia, but it's definitely one of the best I've had outside of Singapore. The Marina location is bigger, while the SOMA location seems to be mostly a grab and go place.

excerpts: and I love the broth.
broth.author: Maggie S.
broth.review: Great, tasty filling lunch and cheap for San Francisco. The chicken is delicious every time and I love the broth.

excerpts: The best part about this place is the broth.
Like oooommmmmmgggggg.
I could just drink this shit all day.
It's so flavorful and oily and goes so well with the chicken.
broth.author: Stephanie K.
broth.review:
The chicken is nice and moist and goes well with rice and the sauce they give you. The portion size is okay, like it won't leave you starving but still not the amount you'd expect from a $13-14 meal. I really like the sauce on the side, even though I'm usually repulsed by ginger because ginger tastes likes soap to me. I mean, it still does, so the sauce tastes like really good thai soap, if that makes sense. They also have a paleo option which is super cool since eating out on a low carb diet can be v difficult.

The best part about this place is the broth. Like oooommmmmmgggggg. I could just drink this shit all day. It's so flavorful and oily and goes so well with the chicken.

excerpts: I got the original which comes with their jasmine rice, chicken, some cucumbers and a side of broth for $12.
It's a bit pricey but the size is decent.
Just wish they had more included options instead of a la carte items like $2 for egg lol.
broth.author: Amanda K.
broth.review:
Busy during lunchtime with nearby yuppies but a good healthy/hearty alternative if you're not feeling a sandwich or salad. 

I got the original which comes with their jasmine rice, chicken, some cucumbers and a side of broth for $12. It's a bit pricey but the size is decent. Just wish they had more included options instead of a la carte items like $2 for egg lol. But all in all, everything tasted clean and the chicken was moist.

Not much table seating but plenty outside!

excerpts: It also came with soup (tasty warm broth), perfect for a chilly day :)
broth.author: Jaclyn C.
broth.review:
Great addition to this east SoMa area with a general lack of Asian food options. The shop was not super spacious but had a few tables and could get very busy during weekday lunch hours. 

Simple menu with just four options, one vegetarian and three with chicken. Five of us got all different chicken options. "Paleo" option could be confusing - no rice and instead more veggies. I wanted to bring it up because their rice was the highlight of the meal for me! Chicken flavor was noticeable in the rice along with garlic and ginger, very tasty and just like in the classic Singapore style Hainan chicken. I got extra veggies (steamed broccoli), though the original portion was already more than enough for me. It also came with soup (tasty warm broth), perfect for a chilly day :)

A bit on the pricey side ($12+ for chicken options) that probably made me not go every time I ate out in the area, but certainly a place I'd crave once in a while.

excerpts: This reminded me a little of Hainanese Chicken Rice, except with a side of chicken broth.
Pretty limited menu, so
at least you know they specialize with their main dish.
The chicken broth was more intense than typical chicken soup (maybe more fat content?)
and did an excellent job at warming up the lukewarm chicken.
The soy-based sauce with ginger, garlic and chili added a ton of personality to the chicken and really was a treat if you dip the chicken in the broth first.
The cucumbers and cilantro help add a nice vegetal kick to cut through the richness of everything else.
The chicken though just wasn't my thing.
The limp boiled skin had such a weird slimy mouthfeel.
The chicken meat itself isn't that warm
so it had the cooled off chicken taste.
And there were pieces of bone and cartilage in the mix.
In theory I'm not opposed to picking meat from the non-meat parts, but not in the middle of the workday when in nice business attire and surrounded by a bunch of professionals.
Pulling a piece of bone out of your mouth and putting it aside just seems so awkward.
broth.author: Adam B.
broth.review:
This reminded me a little of Hainanese Chicken Rice, except with a side of chicken broth.  Pretty limited menu, so at least you know they specialize with their main dish.  It was worth trying, but it's not going to make it into my Top 20 favorite Thai dishes.

The Original:  Oddly, I liked everything about the dish except the actual chicken.  The rice was very rich and full of chicken flavor; I could probably eat mounds of this.  The chicken broth was more intense than typical chicken soup (maybe more fat content?) and did an excellent job at warming up the lukewarm chicken.  The soy-based sauce with ginger, garlic and chili added a ton of personality to the chicken and really was a treat if you dip the chicken in the broth first.  The cucumbers and cilantro help add a nice vegetal kick to cut through the richness of everything else.  The chicken though just wasn't my thing.  The limp boiled skin had such a weird slimy mouthfeel.  The chicken meat itself isn't that warm so it had the cooled off chicken taste.  And there were pieces of bone and cartilage in the mix.  In theory I'm not opposed to picking meat from the non-meat parts, but not in the middle of the workday when in nice business attire and surrounded by a bunch of professionals.  Pulling a piece of bone out of your mouth and putting it aside just seems so awkward.

excerpts: It came with broth too which props to them of it not tasting like oil water.
broth.author: Tao Tao W.
broth.review:
4.5 stars for sure. they had their soft opening today. I have  had the Marina location booked forever to try since thy opened. However, over the weekend I saw this sign go up by mi casa. They took over the old Urban Picnic and its refreshing. They add a different line up to the food scene in SOMA for lunch. Still the same simple 4 item menu but yet so delish. I got the Paleo with breast and a poached egg. A little price at almost $20 for chicken, broccoli, and an egg but it was clean and healthy. It came with broth too which props to them of it not tasting like oil water. 

will def be back.

excerpts: I love that it comes with some chicken soup/broth for the cold weather and the food comes out without a long wait.
Food is in a compostable container and the portion is generous.
I will have to try it with brown rice and the paleo version (without rice).
broth.author: Mei L.
broth.review:
In the former Urban Pinic space and so happy that it is there.

I am use to Singaporean Chicken and Rice, but R & R is a happy addition to the SOMA area. A standard original chicken and rice, is about $11.95 (make sure you get a poached egg for an extra +2), and get the hot sauce they have there because it is amazking.

It comes with chicken over rice and a side of cucumbers and a soybean sauce is the best for a lunch in soma (and with the hot sauce on the side).

I love that it comes with some chicken soup/broth for the cold weather and the food comes out without a long wait. Food is in a compostable container and the portion is generous. I will have to try it with brown rice and the paleo version (without rice).

excerpts: Thai style steamed chicken served with broth and soy ginger sauce.
Very much a San Francisco spin on the Thai original, R&R serves their organic Mary's chicken over (optionally) brown rice in a compostable takeout container.
broth.author: Stephanie T.
broth.review:
Thai style steamed chicken served with broth and soy ginger sauce. Very much a San Francisco spin on the Thai original, R&R serves their organic Mary's chicken over (optionally) brown rice in a compostable takeout container. A far cry from the street food traditionally  presented in a plastic bag!

That said, the preparation is delicious. A lover of chicken thighs personally, I recommend "the classic." The $2 poached egg add on is very good but I don't think necessary given how much sauce the dish comes with. 

Don't be deterred by the line; since they only serve essentially one thing it moves very quickly. Also, in case you're wondering, this place is not a good option for vegetarians. 

My one gripe (and subtracted star) is the high price point. $12-15 for lunch is too high. If in a closer location to home I'd definitely consider this place for dinner. Until then -- or when they realize they can get away with serving Safeway $0.99/lb thighs -- I'll keep this one on my list as a splurgy lunch.

excerpts: The flavors were all there, the sauce was delicious, and the broth was full of flavors!
I recommend trying the habanero sauce if you like spicy.
broth.author: Wendy Y.
broth.review:
I love love love Rooster & Rice! I didn't know about this location until my friend took me here for lunch one day! 

I was so glad we were able to beat the crowd because there was a huge line right after we order. But, the line does move fast from what I've seen. 

Just like their Fillmore location, their original chicken rice did not disappoint! The flavors were all there, the sauce was delicious, and the broth was full of flavors! I recommend trying the habanero sauce if you like spicy. It definitely adds a kick to your meal.

Overall, this is a great spot for lunch, dinner, or whenever you're hungry. It's a little pricey (being about $13 without add-ons), but the quality is great and the food is absolutely delicious. Can't wait to come back!

excerpts: Rooster and rice is the perfect fast casual meal, the chicken broth is so good that I have to order two every time.
broth.author: Betty B.
broth.review: Rooster and rice is the perfect fast casual meal, the chicken broth is so good that I have to order two every time. You can't go wrong with the original hunan chicken!

excerpts: YES it's that good the "original" is delicious with tender chicken over fragrant Jasmine rice and a side of chicken broth.
It's unfortunate the location is embedded into a building hard to find
but if you're near by its worth a one time try.
broth.author: N A.
broth.review: YES it's that good the "original" is delicious with tender chicken over fragrant Jasmine rice and a side of chicken broth. It's unfortunate the location is embedded into a building hard to find but if you're near by its worth a one time try.

excerpts: The broth, rice, and chicken quality (not to mention quantity) are all better than the likes of Hawker Fare and Lers Rhos.

I just wish they were on more delivery platforms like UberEATS-- the only reason I even tried those other khao mun gais is because R&R is only available on Caviar, with absurd delivery minimums (and the restaurant itself is rather far), or else I swear I would be eating R&R
at least 3x/week.
I'm obsessed.
broth.author: Minnia F.
broth.review: I've now tried khao mun gai at a few places in SF (you could say I'm a little obsessed), and hands down Rooster & Rice is above and beyond the best. The broth, rice, and chicken quality (not to mention quantity) are all better than the likes of Hawker Fare and Lers Rhos. I just wish they were on more delivery platforms like UberEATS-- the only reason I even tried those other khao mun gais is because R&R is only available on Caviar, with absurd delivery minimums (and the restaurant itself is rather far), or else I swear I would be eating R&R at least 3x/week. I'm obsessed.

excerpts: The broth was also delicious, but there were no spoons to eat it.
So I wasn't sure if it was a stew or like a juice?
It was alright.
Nothing to talk about.
broth.author: Ashmita V.
broth.review: Great place for lunch. Traditional thai chicken and rice. I had the paleo style without the rice. The chicken was extremely juicy and tender and the chili garlic soy sauce was absolutely decadent. I didn't love the fact that the accompanying veggies were basically broccoli. I felt like they could have been a little more creative there. The broth was also delicious, but there were no spoons to eat it. So I wasn't sure if it was a stew or like a juice? It was alright. Nothing to talk about.

excerpts: The broth was crisp, clean and enhances the flavour of the entire dish.
broth.author: Peter N.
broth.review:
I was craving Khao Man Gai in Portland and I found this little gem close to my work.  I ordered the original and the paleo Togo.  


The thigh meats were so soft, juicy and tender. The skin was just perfect--in my mouth. The broth was crisp, clean and enhances the flavour of the entire dish.  

It's one of my favourites. Super healthy.  Great tasting and very filling. If you're looking for a quick bite without the guilt of unhealthy calories this is your place.  If you're looking for something that comes close to home, this is your place.

excerpts: The sauce that came with the chicken was quite flavorful, the broth that came with the food was quite good as well, and the star of the show (chicken) was tender and tasted quite good.
broth.author: Alexander L.
broth.review:
Eh, A-OK sounds about right for this place, mostly due to the price.

Came late on a Monday (~7:00PM), and ordered a paleo style (mixed breast and thigh meat) with an egg. The sauce that came with the chicken was quite flavorful, the broth that came with the food was quite good as well, and the star of the show (chicken) was tender and tasted quite good. All that combined with the fact that this place seems like a healthy option made it a fairly decent meal overall.

That being said, however, this place is pretty (quite) expensive. At $13 for poached chicken over broccoli, it's quite the premium to pay even by SF FiDi standards. If I ever come back I'm getting a Marina; I found that the paleo style dish wound up with a bunch of juices and no rice-like component to soak them up! Oh, and I'm also going to skip the egg next time. Even though it was cooked quite runny (goes well with the dish I think), I think the additional $2 is not worth it.

As an aside, this place has napkins and togo boxes branded with their logo..!

excerpts: The broth was a good palette cleanser that was smooth and warm.
Also, all their napkins, lids and bags have their signature chicken on them--so cute!
Definitely coming back...everyday...for every meal.
broth.author: Tina P.
broth.review: Simple and incredibly delicious is all you want when it comes to Asian chicken and rice and this place is both. I got the original with an added egg because, duh. The poached chicken was tender and delicious, the rice tasted like it was cooked in chicken fat for 20 days because it was so tasty and the sauce was salty, sweet and brought everything together. The broth was a good palette cleanser that was smooth and warm. Also, all their napkins, lids and bags have their signature chicken on them--so cute! Definitely coming back...everyday...for every meal.

excerpts: The meal consists of tender pieces of chicken served over a bed of chicken-flavored rice with a side of cucumbers, a cup of chicken broth, and a gingery, garlicky soy sauce for heavy dipping.
broth.author: Derick N.
broth.review:
I grew up in an area some pretty amazing Hainan chicken rice, and I'm so excited that this is on par with the stuff from home, in addition to being walking distance from my office!

Rooster & Rice serves the Thai variation of Hainan chicken rice. The meal consists of tender pieces of chicken served over a bed of chicken-flavored rice with a side of cucumbers, a cup of chicken broth, and a gingery, garlicky soy sauce for heavy dipping. There are two other sauces (one tangy and another spicy) you can serve yourself.

While it's a tad more expensive than what I get back home, the price is pretty standard for a lunch in the area. I'd also rather spend that money on $10-12 on some delicious, hearty meat and rice than on a couple of leaves at a salad place to be honest!

Can't wait to get it again!

excerpts: The Original and it comes with a mix of light and dark meat along with white rice (cooked in chicken broth).
Make sure to pour some of the herb-y soy sauce over the chicken to give it some flavor.
The portion size is alright.
I can finish it all without a problem and be full and satisfied but not overstuffed.
A guy with a bigger appetite might be a bit more unsatisfied.
If you need a little more food or want a more balanced meal, add some extra veggies.
The meal also comes with bone broth soup which is simple but tasty.
broth.author: Tiffany S.
broth.review:
Yay for khao mun gai aka Thai chicken rice aka hainan chicken (they all taste the same to me haha but maybe I just don't know any better)! Finally a place around the area that sells a decent version of this dish. It's not the best kind I've ever had but it'll happily satisfy my craving. Also a bit pricey for what it is but welcome to SF I guess.

I order The Original and it comes with a mix of light and dark meat along with white rice (cooked in chicken broth). Make sure to pour some of the herb-y soy sauce over the chicken to give it some flavor. The portion size is alright. I can finish it all without a problem and be full and satisfied but not overstuffed. A guy with a bigger appetite might be a bit more unsatisfied. If you need a little more food or want a more balanced meal, add some extra veggies. The meal also comes with bone broth soup which is simple but tasty. 

Good healthy choice for lunch/dinner! Wish it was closer to my office as I can only get it when I splurge for delivery.

excerpts: Each meal comes with a chicken broth, great for cold days.
broth.author: Marfel L.
broth.review: There are about four lunch options to choose from. "Looks" plain, probably simple if you like crazy flavors, but don't be fooled. Chicken is very juicy and tender with a ton of flavor. Rice is equally delicious and marinated. The ginger soy sauce it comes with makes the meal so much better. Each meal comes with a chicken broth, great for cold days.

excerpts: Delicious poached chicken and rice with a side of chicken broth, broccoli and cucumbers - a wonderful meal any time!
As I like to finish off my meals with tea or something hot, I was very surprised at how the chicken broth complemented the rice and chicken so well.
Highly recommended.
broth.author: Erik S.
broth.review: Delicious poached chicken and rice with a side of chicken broth, broccoli and cucumbers - a wonderful meal any time! As I like to finish off my meals with tea or something hot, I was very surprised at how the chicken broth complemented the rice and chicken so well. Highly recommended.

excerpts: Juicy chicken, aromatic rice, flavorful chicken broth, variety of sauces - what else could a girl ask for?
Love this place so much and will keep coming back!
When I can spend $15 on this (the same price as my salad) and be much fuller and happier eating it, that's not a bad trade off!
Wish they would open on weekends!!
broth.author: Cynthia H.
broth.review: Juicy chicken, aromatic rice, flavorful chicken broth, variety of sauces - what else could a girl ask for? Love this place so much and will keep coming back! When I can spend $15 on this (the same price as my salad) and be much fuller and happier eating it, that's not a bad trade off! Wish they would open on weekends!!

excerpts: It does come with a broth
but I'm not sure how "healthy" it is.
broth.author: Megan L.
broth.review:
I was so happy to find out that there was a Rooster&Rice 1 block from my office! Yay for more (Asian) options. The place is small and trendy. I got in line right before 12 and had to wait about 10 minutes for my dish. By the time I left, the line was twice as long. 

I got the "original" and it definitely filled me up. Pricing is aligned with SF..it came out to be $13 with tax. The menu is limited and simple. It's basically just rice and chicken. It does come with a broth but I'm not sure how "healthy" it is. There is limited seating inside but it looked like majority of people were getting it to go.

I didn't have too much interaction with the workers but they seemed friendly. There are also 2 handsome men working here so that's a plus if you're single, haha!

I would definitely come back again!

excerpts: The menu is a bit one note...but the broth always hits the spot!
broth.author: Mimi T.
broth.review: A simple, healthy option for lunch. The menu is a bit one note...but the broth always hits the spot!

excerpts: The dish also comes with a small cup of chicken broth and cilantro/green onion.
Goes well with the dish.
broth.author: Jeannie L.
broth.review:
I've visited the Marina location and realize they opened one up near my work. YAY!

It's a simple dish, of thai chicken and rice. Think Chinese Hainan chicken but with different sauces, and fragrant rice. The difference maker is the hot sauce on the side, really makes it worth going to. The one they provide is a mix between the original and bold, and it's pretty darn good. You can buy a bottle of it as well. The dish also comes with a small cup of chicken broth and cilantro/green onion. Goes well with the dish. You can either pour it on or drink it solo. 

They had some fried chicken skin pieces to sample as well, and it was delicious. Anything fried is usually amazing. 

It's a little pricey, but in the FiDi, it's kind of expected. I can't remember if the prices were cheaper out in the Marina, but I feel like they would be. 

I'll be back!

excerpts: They give you a lot of chicken - no bones! - and the rice is flavorful, broth tasty, sauce is awesome.
It'll definitely fill you up.
Definitely coming back
and I'm so excited to have it in the neighborhood.
broth.author: Veronica L.
broth.review:
I'm so glad this place opened in soma. I had been to the marina location once and it was great but the marina is so far away for a place that is barely a sit down joint. Anyway so glad it opened it's new location. There is a decent amount of seating inside, one long group table for about 12, and then some bench seating along the window. They rely on everyone going to eat outside in the plaza seating. 
The menu is really straight forward chicken and rice: original version, chicken breast version, vegetable (no chicken), and I think I saw a paleo version (chicken and veggies, no rice). The extras would be an egg, extra chicken, sauce, rice, and soup. 
I love chicken and rice and I've tried to make my own at home and damn is it a lot of work. It's a lot a lot of work. That's why while it is more expensive than I'd like to spend for a quick lunch meal, it's def worth it. It's also a really hearty portion. They give you a lot of chicken - no bones! - and the rice is flavorful, broth tasty, sauce is awesome. It'll definitely fill you up. Definitely coming back and I'm so excited to have it in the neighborhood.

excerpts: Chicken was juicy, broth is delicious.
broth.author: Stephanie C.
broth.review:
So good, I almost didn't write a review because I don't want more people coming and the line getting longer.

I had the Original. Chicken was juicy, broth is delicious.

excerpts: The ginger soy sauce/glaze and broth really heighten the flavor
so I would recommend adding both.
I wish the tofu had it's own seasoning, but it was just plain and bland.
I also would have liked to see more vegetables than just broccoli.
The website says "seasonal vegetables" but surely there are more vegetables in season than just broccoli.
broth.author: Ariana M.
broth.review: My team recently ordered lunch from here via Caviar, per a recommendation from a coworker. I don't eat meat, so I got the vegetarian dish. For a place that specializes in chicken, the vegetarian option was surprisingly good! The ginger soy sauce/glaze and broth really heighten the flavor so I would recommend adding both. I wish the tofu had it's own seasoning, but it was just plain and bland. I also would have liked to see more vegetables than just broccoli. The website says "seasonal vegetables" but surely there are more vegetables in season than just broccoli.

excerpts: The best thing was the broth which was super flavorful.
Rice had a light flavor, which is fine.
(Not as good as Hainanese chinese chicken, but it's fine.)
Khao Mun Gai chicken is poached, where as Hainanese chicken is steamed - but end result is similar.
broth.author: Bonnie H.
broth.review:
Today is Trump's Inauguration day. So I needed something really good for lunch. Something that reminds me that life is worth living. 

I hopped on Yelp and saw that the Urban Picnic was replaced by Rooster & Rice, a place I had seen opened in the Marina, and now here it is - 2 blocks away from my work. Yay!

Upon arriving at Rooster & Rice, i see the line. I expected this as San Franciscans are crazy. I don't usually like lines. Some people go just for the line, it seems, but I stay away. This is the first time, I actually stood in the line. I dunno... maybe it's because today the world is ending. I mean if the US is going to try something new - like elect a fascist, xenophobic, racist, sexist imbecile, then I can also try something new. Like stand in a line.

Upon entry into the actual restaurant, I noticed that it was all asians and their more experimental non-asian friends. I don't know if I had ever seen so many asians in any other SOMA restaurant before. If Trump wanted to put all asians in an internment camp, they can make Rooster & Rice it's capital. He can just fence us all in like chickens.

Anyhow, I got the original. DUH. the OG of course. Jesus - the marina? Really? I'm not judging. I'm just saying... I'm judging.

Everything was pretty good and satisfying. As expected. The best thing was the broth which was super flavorful. Rice had a light flavor, which is fine. (Not as good as Hainanese chinese chicken, but it's fine.) Khao Mun Gai chicken is poached, where as Hainanese chicken is steamed - but end result is similar. Basically a very clean, chickeny flavor. 

This is why only the most experimental of non-asians would ever come here - that poached chicken. I think it's something you grow up with. To the non-asians, it's just rubbery and too chickeny. There's a reason why chicken is battered and fried. Or smothered with bbq sauce. I actually don't love chicken ...but there is something nostalgic about eating poached / steamed chicken. Very comforting. 

The ginger-soy sauce was of course delicious. You gotta have that right. I could talk about hainanese chicken sauce (which is a ginger scallion sauce), but I might have a gang of thai techies come beat me with a coconut hammer. 

(Aww.... don't get mad my Thai cousins... If it's any consolation, the Chinese don't do any noodle dishes as close to delicious as Tom Yum Noodle Soup.... mmmmm... Tom Yum Noodle Soup.)

Anyhow... seriously I'd say the only reason I am giving it 4 stars is because it's not Hainanese Chicken Rice. And I know that's not fair. But you know what... Today, a person who lost the popular vote by 2 million votes is being sworn into office. So life isn't fair. 

Maybe I'll update the review when life is fair again.

excerpts: The meal includes a chicken broth to help wash the meal down.
broth.author: Lester W.
broth.review:
Glad to see that Rooster & Rice has opened up a location in the SoMa area.

I recommend ordering "The Original" and adding the sous vide egg to go with it. The portions are very filling and the ginger/garlic sauce that comes with the meal is delicious. The meal includes a chicken broth to help wash the meal down.

They have some seating inside and plenty of seating outside.

I'll definitely be adding this spot to my lunch rotation.

excerpts: The broth is also really good.
YUMM.
now i'm just craving rooster and rice.......
broth.author: Stephanie W.
broth.review: This place is soooooo good. I wish it was just a LITTLE bit closer to where I live. I always get the original but with only dark meat. The chicken is SO good and tender and has so much flavor. The rice also has a lot of flavor and the combination of the chicken and rice is literally magical. The sauce they provide is also so yummy and brings the rice/chicken to the next level. The broth is also really good. YUMM. now i'm just craving rooster and rice.......

excerpts: The broth is something I've been thinking about on these cold and rainy days.
Just make sure you get the sauce (not spicy) and the broth that comes on the side!
broth.author: Rob M.
broth.review:
My new favorite place for lunch in the area! Simple looking menu with fresh ingredients. The broth is something I've been thinking about on these cold and rainy days. 

I'd spring for the egg and get a sprinkle of their fried chicken skin. The other options are breast meat and brown rice. 

So the last couple times I've either opted for chicken breast and brown rice as an option. Just make sure you get the sauce (not spicy) and the broth that comes on the side!

excerpts: (Chicken, steamed veggies, egg, brown rice) and chicken broth aka fat soup =
I dont think so!
First and Last!
broth.author: Jane D.
broth.review:
Not worth it.. way to simple, taste is ok. Extremely expensive$$$$
Paid $17.95 (Chicken, steamed veggies, egg, brown rice) and chicken broth aka fat soup = I dont think so! First and Last!

excerpts: I love that it includes the broth as well.
Definitely comfort food all the way.
broth.author: Amanda C.
broth.review: Best chicken and rice dish ever! This is one of my favorite go-to lunch spots. I love that it includes the broth as well. Definitely comfort food all the way.

excerpts: The egg is very gooey and mixed in well with rice, and the broth is heaven.
broth.author: Justina H.
broth.review:
The chicken was very moist, and the rice was good as well.

The hot sauce is DELICIOUS.

The egg is very gooey and mixed in well with rice, and the broth is heaven.

Definitely recommend!

excerpts: regarding the broth
, it was nice, but very single note.
i expected radishes and some spring onion, additives that would make the broth crisp and refreshing as it had been at nong's.
broth.author: Angie K.
broth.review:
you sf-ites have it good, man. burmese stops galore, $4 banh mi, andytown, and khao man gai? i hope u guys give thanks for all the goodness you have

anywho

when i saw that theres a place that does khao man gai i h a d to go. i chanced upon this dish for the first time a few month ago at nong's in portland (bless her soul) and i think its safe to say it kinda changed my life. dont sleep on khao man gai. "room temp chicken" sounds whack but when the sauce is right, such a simple, barebones dish can prove to be one of the most replenishing, fulfilling meals you could enjoy. 

and now reeling back from my philosophical divergence: i ordered the marina with extra vegetables and sauce.

it was ok! the sauce is pungent as it should be. it looked like there was some dried shrimp in the sauce alongside some pepper that added a much-needed kick. the chicken was most definitely not dry, despite it being skinless breast. the brown rice was cooked, all i could ask for. just barely the right amount for a proper chicken:rice ratio. the extra vegetables i got didn't seem to make it to my take-out container? or perhaps a few extra slices of cucumber were the extra vegetable, in which case, the +$2 was definitely not worth it.

regarding the broth, it was nice, but very single note. i expected radishes and some spring onion, additives that would make the broth crisp and refreshing as it had been at nong's. it sorta tasted like low-grade sushi miso soup with some chicken fat incorporated into the base.

eventually the marina + veggies + sauce (had to meet a minimum for the caviar order) rang up to be around $18 with the silly sf tax included. it was nice to fix the khao man gai craving, but not worth that heavy hit to the wallet.

really nice and clean store tho! wish i'd given the original location a try too

excerpts: The chicken broth is also good.
The reason I'm dropping a star is because I don't think this meal is worth $13.
Lunch is consistently less than $10 in the area
so it's difficult to justify putting in the weekly lunch rotation.
Adding an egg is $2 and a side of 6oz of fried chicken skin is $5.
Pricey indeed.
But yeah, it's good.
And you should totally try it.
broth.author: Andrew D.
broth.review: Kao mun gai is one of my favorite Thai dishes and I feel like it's not that common in SF. I've really only had it at the renowned Nong's in Portland. It's been a long time since I've been there so it's hard to compare but Rooster & Rice is certainly quite good. I always order the Original. The chicken feels fresh, tender, and juicy. The rice is super flavorful and most importantly... the sauce is just perfect. The chicken broth is also good.  The reason I'm dropping a star is because I don't think this meal is worth $13. Lunch is consistently less than $10 in the area so it's difficult to justify putting in the weekly lunch rotation. Adding an egg is $2 and a side of 6oz of fried chicken skin is $5. Pricey indeed.  But yeah, it's good. And you should totally try it.

excerpts: The fact that every order comes with a soul warming cup of chicken soup broth is just a bonus.
broth.author: David H.
broth.review: Great hainanese chicken place that has delicious food and good execution. I love that you can customize the order and add dark meat if that's your thing, or add a poached egg. It's pricey for what it is (ie. chicken and rice), but it is some of the best you'll have in the area. Be warned, lines can be vicious during rush hours, and you might die of hunger and jealousy as you see others enjoying their food. The fact that every order comes with a soul warming cup of chicken soup broth is just a bonus.

excerpts: The orders come with a small bowl of soup broth which is nice and warm.
Really good garlic ginger sauce that goes on the (soft and delicious) rice and chicken.
Less stars though because it is really expensive for such a simple dish, though it definitely has to do with the area that they are in.
broth.author: Suzan A.
broth.review: Such good chicken and rice! This was my first stop in SF and its a small little place with only a couple seats. Most people who ordered here were taking to go. The orders come with a small bowl of soup broth which is nice and warm. Really good garlic ginger sauce that goes on the (soft and delicious) rice and chicken. Less stars though because it is really expensive for such a simple dish, though it definitely has to do with the area that they are in.

excerpts: Chicken was moist and the broth was delicious.
However, waiting almost 20 minutes for lunch was not ideal.
Perhaps it was just the day, but for how basic the menu is, it doesn't make much sense why I would have to wait so long.
broth.author: Matt F.
broth.review: The food itself was simple, but very good and healthy. Chicken was moist and the broth was delicious. However, waiting almost 20 minutes for lunch was not ideal. Perhaps it was just the day, but for how basic the menu is, it doesn't make much sense why I would have to wait so long.

excerpts: Within 10 minutes, I had finished everything and washed down the food with the chicken broth, leaving me feeling very happy about the meal.
broth.author: Hank F.
broth.review: I ordered The Original near closing time on a Friday. Having missed my lunch during normal hours, I was starving and found the first bite of the chicken to be gratifying. The ginger sauce, the poached egg yolk, and the well-brined chicken breast with skin, topped with a few drips of habanero sauce, made for an amazing combination. Within 10 minutes, I had finished everything and washed down the food with the chicken broth, leaving me feeling very happy about the meal.

excerpts: There is no amount of special sauce and veggie broth in the world that can make a box of lukewarm, unseasoned tofu and steamed broccoli into a delicious treat for me :(
broth.author: saru k.
broth.review: This review is strictly for the vegetarians, because I desperately wanted to love this place despite all the red flags, i.e. the restaurant name and logo, that this place was not intended for our kind.  They were so nice, and the aesthetic is awesome, and the people outside munching on their chicken seemed so happy. But. There is no amount of special sauce and veggie broth in the world that can make a box of lukewarm, unseasoned tofu and steamed broccoli into a delicious treat for me :(

excerpts: Meals come with rice, chicken, broth and their special dipping sauce for the chicken.
The amount of chicken I got was not a lot for the price I paid
but then again it's SF...
And my chicken was chopped up in tiny bits, I think it might have been the leftovers from previous chicken.
I wasn't completely full afterwards and the taste of the chicken was bland without the sauce.
Extra sauce is 1$z I wouldn't come here again unless friends want try it.
broth.author: Vicky C.
broth.review: This is probably the closest thing to hainan chicken if that's what you're looking for. The place is small, limited seating and a few tables outside. Only a few choices to choose from. Meals come with rice, chicken, broth and their special dipping sauce for the chicken. The amount of chicken I got was not a lot for the price I paid but then again it's SF...And my chicken was chopped up in tiny bits, I think it might have been the leftovers from previous chicken. I wasn't completely full afterwards and the taste of the chicken was bland without the sauce. Extra sauce is 1$z I wouldn't come here again unless friends want try it.

excerpts: Sauce is fantastic (get extra) and the broth is a tasty way to wash it down.
broth.author: J M.
broth.review: Second location, original is in the Marina.  Happy to have this addition to the SoMa area.  Go-to healthy, nutritious comfort food. Tender, well-prepared Thai Chicken Rice with a few variations including skinless, vegetables instead of rice, etc.  Sauce is fantastic (get extra) and the broth is a tasty way to wash it down.

excerpts: There is a side of sauce (ginger and garlic sauce = THE BOMB) and they have Habanero hot sauce and Thai Sriracha
(I use a combo of both).
habanero hot sauce.author: Michele L.
habanero hot sauce.review:
Solid 4 stars. This place is on our take-out rotation, especially when we feel like being a bit more healthy.

The menu is simple: chicken + rice. You can choose between poached white meat or white/dark meat, and brown rice (+1 extra) or jasmine rice. The chicken is extremely tender and the rice is fragrant (they call it chicken rice). There is a side of sauce (ginger and garlic sauce = THE BOMB) and they have Habanero hot sauce and Thai Sriracha (I use a combo of both). My favorite part is the broth they give you on the side - I'm not sure how they do it but it is the cleanest yet most flavorful chicken broth I've ever had! Really my favorite part!!! They also sell a limited selection of drinks as well as whole baby coconuts if you want fresh coconut water :)

This location is open Mon - Fri and closes at 8pm. There is plenty of seating inside and outside and the line/wait is very short during dinnertime.

excerpts: Make sure to grab some of their homemade habanero hot sauce!
habanero hot sauce.author: Janie L.
habanero hot sauce.review: Hands down the best meal I had in SF. Looking at the picture you wouldn't think anything special; in fact, I had it bookmarked but we decided not go. Rooster & Rice happened to be next door to a place we were visiting, so we said why not. I am so glad we did. The dish looks so simple yet the flavors are so complex. The rice is cooked in the chicken broth and the chicken is so juicy and tender. The ginger sauce compliments the dish very well. Make sure to grab some of their homemade habanero hot sauce!

excerpts: I tried it with their habanero hot sauce and it was amazing!
habanero hot sauce.author: Ang W.
habanero hot sauce.review:
I've been wanting to check this place out since I've returned from my vacation to Singapore. It looks and tastes just like Hainanese chicken but they call it Thai chicken. Anyways, the chicken was super tasty and moist. The sauce that comes with it compliments it so well. The rice was a bit too moist to my liking but still very flavorful. I tried it with their habanero hot sauce and it was amazing! Definitely satisfied my Hainanese chicken and rice craving!

The broth on the other hand was a bit too salty for me so I didn't finish that.

excerpts: When I took a bite of their chicken with a scoop of the rice with a little bit of their habanero hot sauce, I was in full chicken heaven bliss.
Not only is their chicken good, but the rice is packed with chicken oils and flavor.
I have not tasted a chicken rice this flavorful in a very long time.
Many Chinese places serve Hainanese chicken rice, but most of them fail to deliver juicy chicken and flavorful rice.
habanero hot sauce.author: Hoyan L.
habanero hot sauce.review:
I'm a HUGEEE fan of chicken and rice dishes, particularly Hainan chicken rice. When I saw this place popped up, I knew I had to pay it a visit! After a long day at work, I was really craving something simple and delicious and Rooster & Rice was just around the corner. 

I have never had Khao Mun Gai, which is a Thai version of Hainanese chicken rice, but I have had Hainanese chicken rice countless times in the past. I ordered their Original (around $12 with tax). Their Original is a combination of chicken thigh and breast all boneless on a wonderful bed of fragrant rice with a side of chicken broth. The Asian me screams thigh meat is the way to go for all chicken dishes since chicken breasts are often super dry and tasteless. However, their chicken breast meat super tender, flavorful, and juicy. When I took a bite of their chicken with a scoop of the rice with a little bit of their habanero hot sauce, I was in full chicken heaven bliss. Not only is their chicken good, but the rice is packed with chicken oils and flavor. I have not tasted a chicken rice this flavorful in a very long time. Many Chinese places serve Hainanese chicken rice, but most of them fail to deliver juicy chicken and flavorful rice. This place has PERFECTED their chicken and their rice. 

Once I took the first bite of this mega flavorful chicken and rice, I couldn't stop myself from finishing the entire box. Put some of their housemade sweet, sour, garlicky, gingery sauce and the housemade habanero sauce onto the chicken rice to give it the most perfect spice and flavorful kick. If you find yourself in need of some veggies, you can crunch on little pieces of cucumber that are given as a side. If you want to wash down your chicken rice with some liquid, you can drink their super flavorful chicken broth. You will be in full chicken heaven!!
